texts.fr:
Mariée, mère d’un enfant  âgé de  02 ans et ayant une personne à sa charge. Depuis 7ans, elle s’approvisionne à Kinshasa en bijoux pacotilles qu’elle revend au marché sur un étalage. Elle maitrise la qualité et les modèles actuels pour satisfaire la demande de ses clientes, elle vend par jour 50.000F à 70.000F. 

Avec le prêt, elle va acheter : les parures pour les cérémonies, les ensembles colliers, boucles d’oreilles, bracelets, bagues, vernis à ongle, peigne à cheveux, des barrettes à cheveux. 
Etant deja a son deuxieme cycle, elle a rembourser son pret son difficultes et a fait des epargnes considerables pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif , vendre  beaucoup afin d'elargir son activite et d’ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
This woman is a married mother of one child aged 2, and has one person in her care. For seven years, she has been getting supplies of costume jewelry in Kinshasa, which she re-sells at the market at a display stand. She has mastered her knowledge of the various qualities and current models in order to satisfy her customers' requests. She makes between 50,000 F and 70,000 F worth of sales each day.

With this loan, she is going to buy ceremonial finery, sets of necklaces, earrings, bracelets, rings, nail polish, decorative combs, and barrettes.

Being on her second loan cycle, she repaid her previous loan without difficulty and made considerable savings in order to achieve her objective, which was to sell a large quantity of items so as to expand her business and open a shop.

loans.use: To buy necklaces, earrings, bracelets, rings, and nail polish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other has graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past ten years, Beatrice has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her potential customers are restaurant operators and passers-by. Beatrice dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.
With this 60,000 KES loan, Beatrice wants to renovate her chicken house and purchase more chicks. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her chicken house and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 14 and 7. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material (fabric) or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Konah

texts.en: Konah is 31 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married and has two children, aged one and nine, who live at home and are in school. She started her business by selling charcoal; today she sells from a table in the local market. One thing she likes about her business is that it gives her more profit and fast money. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice and spices for her business. She hopes to build a house and buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice and spices for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulk rice, oil and supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48 year-old married man with ten children.  He owns a house in Fort Portal, Uganda.   Joseph is a builder and also deals in quarrying stones.  The major challenge is during the rainy season when the roads to the quarry are impassable.  His desire is to solely own the quarry site.  

Joseph needs the loan to hire people to quarry stones.  His dream is to construct rental houses so as to financially sustain his family.

loans.use: To hire more people to quarry stones.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, Roda has operated a clothes sales business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Roda dreams of owning her own business premises in the future.
With this 50,000 KES loan, Roda wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pedro William

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, en su familia solamente él trabaja vendiendo ropa y medicina, este negocio lo aprendió cuando era empleado de un comercial y luego se decidió a instalar el negocio, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades y tiene la esperanza de continuar creciendo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa (blusas, faldas, camisas formales) también medicamentos como analgésicos, antibióticos, vitaminas, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes una variedad de productos.
Su objetivo es para el futuro ganar experiencia e instalar un negocio fuerte, estable, con local fijo, donde pueda atender a los clientes y garantiza a su familia ingresos constantes, que cubran todas las necesidades.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and three children.  He is the only one in his family who works.  He sells clothes and medicines.  He learned this business when he worked as an employee in a store and then decided to set up his own business.  Up to now, he hasn't had any problems and he hopes his business will continue to grow.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy clothes (blouses, skirts and dress shirts).  He will also buy medicines such as painkillers, antibiotics and vitamins.  This investment will help him to keep his business running and enable him to offer his customers a variety of products.

Pedro's goal for the future is to gain experience and have a strong, stable business with fixed premises where he can serve his customers and guarantee constant income for his family in order to meet all their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes (blouses, skirts, dress shirts) for his business

loans.name: Desman

texts.en:
Desman is a 26 year-old married man with three children, living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to own a permanent house.

After dropping out of school due to lack of funds, he decided to venture into farming and he is happy with the way business is growing.  Desman needs the loan to clear land for planting cow peas.  His dream is to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes

loans.use: To clear land for planting cow peas.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while one is still young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For the past year, she has operated a pre-school for young children. Her potential customers are children from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a permanent school in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to renovate the classrooms and increase the number of classrooms to accommodate upper classes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate the classrooms and add classrooms to accommodate upper classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 29 year-old hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Moses has been in the transportation business for three years now and, according to him, has faced no major constraints.  

He needs the loan to buy a new motocycle.  His dream is to buy a plot of land on which to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a new motocycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a twenty-nine year-old married woman with two children, and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been a tailor for four years, and she has been able to pay school fees for her children with the money earned. Her hardship is seasonal business, and her vision is business expansion plus educating her children.

Elizabeth needs the loan to buy cloth for sewing.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.ru: Махлиё жительница города Худжанд. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она вместе с детьми и мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Mahliyo lives in the town of Khujand. She is 31 years old. Married, with four children. Together with her husband and children, she does animal farming. She raises cattle for resale. She has been in this line of work for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy  a byoung bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a fifty-four year-old married man with three children.   He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been dealing in scrap metal for five years, during which time he got his initial capital from selling some of his household belongings.  From this business, he has been able to build a house, which is almost complete. His challenge is scarcity of scrap.  His vision is to set up a workshop in addition to educating his children.  

Pascal needs the loan to buy scrap metal.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Elodie Christianne

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 39ans et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varient entre 11 à 15ans. elle débute son activité de vente de sous vêtement(jupon et slip) en 1995 avec un capital de 100.000frs, elle s'approvisionne dans les boutiques de la place et parfois chez les commercants qui viennent de l'Afrique de l'Ouest . ses  ventes journaliere sont de 15000 à 20000fr.
Avec ce prêt elle va acheter ses sous vêtements tel que des maillot de bain, des sous vêtements pour dames, jeunes filles et hommes et des jupons.

Sa strategie est de chercher les produits a la mode et faire  des prix abordables. son souhait est d'accroître dans son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de mieux sa famille.
texts.en:
A married mother of 3 children whose ages range from 11 to 15, this woman began her business selling undergarments (petticoats and women's underwear) in 1995 with 100,000 Fr worth of capital. She gets her supplies at local stores and sometimes from the merchants who come from West Africa. Her daily sales range from 15,000 to 20,000 Fr.
With this loan, she is going to buy undergarments such as swimsuits, underwear for ladies, young women, and men, and petticoats.

Her strategy is to find fashionable products and sell them at affordable prices. Her hope is to expand her business in order to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy undergarments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, because she wants to help her husband to improve his Punjabi food restaurant business. Her husband operates his business from the market and sells different types of Punjabi food and bread to his customers. His food is very popular among his customers because of its good taste. 
With this loan, he will buy ingredients such as lentils, spices, rice, cooking oil, etc. for making better quality food. He will also increase the seating arrangements for his customers.  
Razia is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her eldest son works while the other remains at home. Razia was not able to educate them due to financial constraints. Her husband has been operating his business for the past 16 years and he is very experienced in his work. Razia hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve the financial conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her husband's Punjabi restaurant business.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a 45 year-old married man with six children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Saidi does welding work of all sorts and has been in this kind of business for 20 years. His major constraint has been inadequate capital to buy the necessary equipment. 

Saidi needs the loan to buy angle bars, welding rolls and mud plates.  His dream is to own a workshop and to be able to pay school fees for all his children

loans.use: To buy angle bars, welding rolls and mud plates.

loans.name: Tubaganze Cb Group

texts.en:
Pierrinne is 33 years old and a mother of two children aged three and eleven. She is part of a group of 26 members and is the president of the group. She is raising her hand in the photo.
Pierrinne owns a salon – she began by plaiting people's hair in a salon and she later opened her own salon. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. Pierrinne is requesting a loan to buy more hair plaiting materials. Many of the group members own general stores where they sell different kinds of items such as sugar, salt, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and chairs for her pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Enid has been dealing in second-hand clothes for 13 years. She started as a market vendor but later rented a shop. Her main hardship is high rental costs. Her vision is to have a wholesale business and to construct a commercial house. Enid is requesting a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 46-year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Francis has been in the transport business for 20 years. He acquired capital to buy a car from farming. His main hardship is traffic officers who demand money, even when he is not in the wrong. His vision is to own a taxi. Francis is requesting a loan facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cream, tortillas, salt, onions, vinegar, bags, napkins and cheese.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a twenty six year old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for six years. He started as a hawker with 50,000 UGX as his working capital and now he has 3,500,000 UGX and an established business premise. His hardships are high transport charges, license fees and thieves. His vision for the future involves opening up another shop, plus having a prosperous family. Emmanuel needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is married with three children, all of whom are studying in a local school. Nasreen is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is a very helpful and supportive person and always carries out her responsibilities very efficiently. 
Nasreen's husband is involved in making electrical wires and cables to order. He makes business deals with different electrical equipment supply companies to fulfill their orders to earn profits. It is Nasreen’s family business and her eldest son also helps his father after his studies in making the wires. 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially support her husband in his business. He will use the loan to buy material such as copper etc. to be able to fulfill his clients' orders on time and make larger profits. 
Nasreen's husband has been operating his business for the past 20 years. Nasreen is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve the living conditions of her family as a result. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy copper etc. for electric wires and cable-making business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Vive en la localidad de el Torno, es soltero, su actividad es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde el torno a la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  vive en la casa de sus padres que son de edad avanzada, el mantiene solo el hogar, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir un habitación para que así el pueda vivir mas cómodo,  con sus ingreso le ayuda a sus padres, hace unos 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad, es un cliente antiguo de la institución por lo que se siente agradecido por el apoyo económico que se le brindara.
texts.en:
José lives in the town of El Torno.  He is single and his business activity is providing a passenger transport service between El Torno and the city of Santa Cruz.  José lives in his elderly parents' home.  He is the only one who supports their household.  José will use this loan to finish building a room so that he can live more comfortably.  He uses his income to help his parents.  He has been in his business for ten years.

José is a long-standing client of our institution and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is given.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and lives in Bardnerville. She is married and has children between the ages of 15 and 21 who live with her at home.

For the past three years she has been selling rice and drinks. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, cold water, oil and charcoal. She plans to expand her business, send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, cold water, oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is a forty two year old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Imran has been in the transportation and farming business for fifteen years. This has enabled him to educate his children. His hardships are poultry diseases and unstable prices. His vision for the future is to have a big poultry farm. Imran needs the credit service to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a thirty seven year old widow. She has one child and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Jennifer has been dealing in second hand clothes and footwear for eight years. She started as a vendor, but later saved and moved into a business premise. Her hardship is seasonal demand for clothes and her vision is to diversify. She would like to go into fish sales. She would also like to build a bigger family home. Jennifer needs the loan to buy clothes and foot wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es: El cliente Aniceto el es mecánico dedicado a la compra y venta de motores, el realiza la compra de motores a medio uso para poder repararlos y venderlos como semi nuevos en buen funcionamiento, este trabajo lo realiza en su taller de mecánica, el cliente es bastante sacrificado y empeñoso en el mismo ya que con el ingreso que obtiene realizando este trabajo puede dar de alimentar a su familia y cubrir todos los gastos de servicio durante el mes, el crédito que solicita el cliente es para poder aumentar su capital y mantener variedad de motores para la disponibilidad de sus clientes, es una persona muy amable preocupado por su familia, trabajador, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Aniceto is a mechanic who buys and sells engines.  He buys pre-used engines in order to repair them and then sell them as semi-new engines in good working order.  He carries out this work in his workshop.  Aniceto is quite self-sacrificing and determined in his work since he uses the income that he makes to feed his family and cover his monthly bills.  

Aniceto is requesting this loan so that he can increase his capital and have a variety of engines available to sell to his customers.  He is a very kind, hard-working person who looks after his family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy a range of car engines

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a thirty six year old married man who has one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Edward has been in the produce business for one year. He started with four million UGX and now has six million UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuation. He has a vision to own a food store plus he would like to have his own transport means. Edward needs the credit facility to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a Ugandan male, aged 34 years, who needs a loan to buy fertilizer to prepare land for farming. He hails from Kyenjojo district. Rashid is a father of three children, living in a semi permanent house. He takes care of 5 people. For ten years he has been a farmer, mainly growing bananas. His dream is  to buy a vehicle for transporting farm products and he also looks forward to supplying his bananas beyond his district.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to prepare land for farming.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 66 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 7 hijos en las edades de 30 a 37 años; ella se dedica al tradicional oficio de la confección de ropa en todas las líneas, pero principalmente uniformes y conjuntos para damas y pantalones. Desde el año 1995, inició con su hija su negocio con 10 máquinas, y su yerno se encargaba de la estrategia de mercadeo, logrando conseguir muchas empresa como clientes; durante 5 años, el desempeño de esta unidad de negocio  fue muy bueno,  pero su hija enviudó y Maria Cristina no pudo seguir de la misma manera,  porque su hija se dedicó a otras actividades, debido a la disminución de sus ventas. Hoy   Maria Cristina, cuenta con una máquina fileteadora y una industrial,  y aunque maneja  contratos con empresas y almacenes, el mercado es más doméstico y confecciona  uniformes, multiusos y ropa sobre medidas. Su meta más adelante es expandir su mercado y generar mejores ingresos, aunque su gran desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la Razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas y una máquina para hacer ojales, mejorando con esta inversión la terminación de su tarea productiva. Mientras Maria Cristina trabaja por el cumplimiento de su sueño, se esmera por  manejar una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 26%  y por lograr con su disciplina el logro de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina, 66, is a married woman with 7 sons and daughters from ages 30 to 37.  Her business is the traditional one of making all types of clothing, but mostly school uniforms and outfits for women, and pants.  Since 1995 when she began the business with her daughter with 10 sewing machines and her son-in-law who was in charge of marketing strategy, she has succeeded in getting a lot of business from customers.  For 5 years the results of this business were very good, but her daughter lost her husband  and Maria Cristina couldn't continue working the same way because her daughter got involved in other things, so her sales dropped.

Maria Cristina has an overlock sewing machine and an industrial machine, and although she handles contracts with businesses and department stores, her market is more domestic with the making of uniforms, multiuse clothing and items taken on order.

Her goal for the future is to expand the market and generate higher earnings, although her big problem is insufficient working capital to make it happen.  This is the reason she is requesting her first Kivaloan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy basic supplies and a buttonhole maker, improving with this investment the end product of her work.  While Maria Cristina works to fulfill her dream, she hopes to manage a profit of 26% on the sales and to succeed with her dreams by the discipline in her work.

loans.use: To buy basic supplies and a buttonhole maker

loans.name: La Rubia Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Rubia lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Damaris quien se dedica al comercio de artesanía en el norte del país. Ella por su negocio vive viajando una semana está en el norte comercializando con una muchacha y otra semana viene a traer mercadería a Masaya en especial fajas, gorras, sombreros…etc.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son la señora Martha quien realiza tortillería y los fines vende nacatamales, moronga, frito etc. y Silvia Rosa vende frescos, gaseosa y pan.
texts.en:
The La Rubia group is made up of three hard-working, energetic, and enterprising women.  Damaris, the coordinator of the group, sells handicrafts in the north of the country. She is always travelling for her business; one week she's in the North with an assistant selling her products, and another week she brings merchandise to Masaya, especially belts, caps, hats. 

The other members of the group are Martha who makes tortillas, and on weekends sells nacatamales (steamed corncakes), morongo (blood sausage), and fried dishes, and Silvia Rosa who sells fruit drinks, sodas, and bread.

loans.use: To sell handicrafts, especially belts, caps and hats

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.es: El Sr. Kenneth trabaja en el transporte público, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas, trabaja en la línea  de taxi trufis, con una experiencia superior a 3 años en el rubro y en la misma línea. Vive en la casa de sus papás, tiene un hijo, que lo cuida su mamá, el cliente no tiene ninguna relación con la mamá de su hijo pero pasa pensión mensualmente para la manutención del niño. El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio a los pasajeros, es un apersona muy trabajadora deseando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Kenneth works in public transportation. He belongs to transportation union and works for a taxi company that has fixed routes. He has three years experience in this job and with the same company.

Kenneth lives with his parents. He has a son whom his mother looks after as he no longer has any relationship with his son’s mother. However, he does provide money on a monthly basis for his son.

The loan is to pay for maintenance of his vehicle which has a few problems so he is no longer able to provide a good service to his passengers.

Kenneth is a very hardworking person who wishes to improve his standard of living as well as that of his son. He is grateful to the institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a resident of Kakata, is a freshman student at the university. He is married, and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three children, age 1, 7 and 12. two are currently in school.

For the past four years he has been selling imported jeans, blouses, slippers and t-shirts for men and women. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more jeans and t-shirts. He hopes to build a house for his children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Galileo Willy

texts.en:
Galileo Willy is a teacher who also does farming. He hails from Kyenjojo district. Galileo is a Ugandan male, aged 36 years, father of five children. His wife is a teacher and their dream is to educate their children up to university level. 

Galileo wants a loan to improve his banana plantation so as to become a model farmer. He has been in this business for 10 years. He began with a small farm but now has over 20 acres of banana plantation. His hardships are fluctuating prices and limited capital to modernize his plantation. His dream is owning fifty acres of bananas.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Rama

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 28ans et mère d'un enfant âgée de 3ans. après son BEPC et par manque de soutien scolaire elle se lance dans la vente des oignons en 2006 avec un capital de  100.000. ses ventes journalière varient de 30000 à 80000.
 avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son activité en achetant plusieurs filets d'oignon, tel que l'oignon rouge et l'oignon blanc  et les echalotes .

elle aimerait avoir un stock plus consistant afin d'être grossiste dans les jours futurs.
Ses ambitions c'est de soutenir la scolarite de son enfant,ainsi que sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman is a 28-year-old married mother of one child aged 3. After her BEPC (secondary school certification), she did not have educational support and so began selling onions in 2006 with 100,000 Fr. worth of capital. Her daily sales range from 30,000 to 80,000 Fr.
With this loan, she is going to strengthen her business by buying several bags of onions of various types, including red onions, white onions, and shallots.

She would like to have a more consistent stock in order to be a wholesaler in the future. Her ambition is to support the education of her child as well as her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and salt. He is a Ugandan male, aged 43 years, who hails from the Kyenjojo district. He is a retailer and a father of 4 children, aged five to sixteen years old. He lives together with his wife and children. 

Joseph has been in this business, operating the retail shop, for seven years. With the proceeds of his retail sales, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Limited capital limits his business plan and in the future he wants to start up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Ana Cesilia

texts.es: Ana Cesilia ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 3 pero solamente uno de sus hijos esta bajo su cargo. Inicio hace 11 años con esta actividad, tiene que levantarse temprano para salir a ofrecer cada día sus productos. El entusiasmo  de trabajar y sacar a su familia delante es lo que ha hecho que Ana este pendiente de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, calzado, cosméticos, bolsos y ropa en general.  Ella desea ampliar su inventario también quiere obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Cesilia sells general merchandise.  She has three children, but only supports one of them.  She began her business 11 years ago.  She has to get up early to go out each day and sell her products.  Her enthusiasm for working and helping her family get ahead in life have made Ana devoted to her business.  

She is applying for a loan to buy towels, sheets, footwear, cosmetics, handbags and clothing. She wishes to expand her inventory, and also wants to start another business.

loans.use: To sell towels, sheets, footwear, cosmetics, handbags, and clothing

loans.name: Abadahigwa Cb Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is 37 years old. She has five children who are aged 5 to 16 years old. Some of her children are adopted. Her husband is a house constructor.

Immaculee owns a general store in which she sells different items such as cooking oil, peanuts, etc. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and improve their standards of living. She needs a loan to buy more items such as cooking oil, peanuts, etc.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 46 years old and married with two children aged 11 and 12. She runs a provision store in Goderich, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of relatives as well as immediate family.
Kadiatu sells biscuits, Ovaltine, candles, chocolates and soft drinks at her store. She has owned this business for five years. Kadiatu also receives income from her husband. She says that her foodstuffs business is doing well.
Kadiatu requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC Sierra Leone, to purchase more provisions such as eggs, milk, biscuits and chocolates. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions such as eggs, milk, biscuits and chocolates.

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Bhawani is 40 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 21 and 18. In 2000, Bhawani established her cow-raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid a previous loan from Patan BPW. She used this recent loan to purchase a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Bhawani plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Ledis Maria

texts.es: Ledys  de 41 años de edad  vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, estudiantes,  en las edades de 11 a 17 años, en el barrio Carrizal, y allí mismo tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios de videojuegos y PlayStation, a clientes en edades juveniles e infantiles principalmente.   Su idea emprendedora ocurrió cuando de aguinaldo le dio a su hijo un videojuego y tos los niños con esta adquisición se reunían en casa para jugar sanamente. Inicialmente compraron 2 televisores y juegos play, su meta es crecer, porque cada día la clientela es mayor, pero   su insuficiente capital de trabajo no le permite hacerlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará 2 televisores más, 2 play Station. Pues está dispuesta en compañia de su esposo a aumentar sus ingresos con tal de cumplir su gran sueño de tener vivienda propia y en la actualidad está en trámites de postulación para lograr el subsidio, así mismo lograr que sus hijos sean exitosos teniendo la oportunidad de ingresar a estudios superiores y especializados. Mientras esto ocurre Ledy continua esmerándose por sostener en su negocio un margen de rentabilidad no inferior a un 35% y una liquidez de 2 a 1.
texts.en:
Ledis, 41, lives with her husband and three school-aged children, 11 through 17 years old, in the Carrizal neighborhood.  Here she offers videogame and PlayStation services, mainly to youngsters and adolescents.  Her idea for a business occurred to her when one Christmas her son received a videogame and all the local kids would meet up in her house to play.  

Initially she bought two television sets and PlayStation games.  Her goal is to expand since her daily customer base is increasing.  The problem is she doesn't have enough capital and is requeting a credikiva loan to buy two more TV sets and two PlayStations.  She and her husband are intent on increasing their income in order to carry out their dream of having their own house, for which they have applied for a subsidy.  They also want to give their children a good, specialized education so they will have the opportunity to be successful.  Meanwhile, Ledis continues working hard to maintain her business which has a profitability of at least 35% and a liquidity of 2 to 1.

loans.use: To buy two more television sets and two PlayStations

loans.name: Baliyeijukira  Kiseke Group

texts.en: Sarah is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged between 17-22 years, living in her own permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For 10 years, Sarah has been operating a bar and shop. From this business, she has been able to educate her children. She faces a challenge of defaulters, but hopes to expand her business to a wholesale status. Sarah wants a loan to buy more mobile phone airtime, beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soap, soda and mobile phone airtime to sell.

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William,  es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, poseen casa propia, él tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad agrícola, ya que desde joven inicio las labores agrícolas junto a su padre.
Hoy en día William se encuentra con sus nuevos cultivos, los cuales necesitan abono y tratamiento para plagas como herbicidas, para ello solicita un préstamo que le solvente la necesidad de fortalecer y prevenir riesgos de plagas en sus cultivos.
Para él, su objetivo como agricultor es que cada siembra le produzca buenos frutos, sanos y abundantes, así como también poder comercializar y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
William is a farmer who lives with his wife and two children, aged three and six, in their own home. He has a lot of experience in the farming business, since he was young when he began working in agriculture alongside his father. 

These days William finds himself with newly planted crops, which need fertilizer and treatments for maladies, such as herbicides. To that end he is seeking a loan to pay for the need to fortify his crops and protect them from maladies. 

For him, his objective as a farmer is that each harvest would produce a good yield, healthy and abundant, as well as to be able to sell them, and provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Goireti

texts.en:
Goireti is a forty six year old widow. She has four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Goireti has been dealing in second hand clothes for five years. She got her capital from farming. Her hardship has been bad debtors and theft. Her vision is to own a boutique in the future and to educate her children. Goireti intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 40 years-old. She is married and has 3 children, aged 22, 25 and 29.  

In 1999, Nirmala established her cow-raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to purchase a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Nelis Estela

texts.es:
Nelis, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, es ama D. casa y su esposo es agricultor, iniciaron la agricultura apoyándose mutuamente, no tiene un horario establecido para la ejecución D. las labores agrícolas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. insumos agrícolas tales como abono y fertilizantes, la compra es muy necesaria pues ya su cultivo necesita que se le apliquen las formulas necesarias para fortalecerse y obtener una buena producción.
Su objetivo es crecer en sus cultivos, obtener buenas cosechas y vivir D. una manera ordenada con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelis lives with her family - her husband and 2 children. She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. They started the farm together, helping each other out. She does not have a fixed schedule for her farm work.

She asks for a loan to buy agricultural inputs like manure and fertilizers. The purchase is very necessary because she needs to apply the right formulas to strengthen her crop and get a good product.

Her goals are to increase her crops, get good harvests and live an ordered life with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 26 years old and married with three children aged  seven years to five months living in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. For two years, Julius has been dealing in the bar and lodging business and from this business he has been able to build a house, although it's not yet complete. He faces the challenges of the high labor turnover and bottles getting lost but hopes to put up another bar with a new pool table and employ skilled manpower. Julius wants a loan to buy a pool table.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for the bar.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 41ans mère de quatre enfants dont l'âge varient de 5 à 17ans dont trois sont scolarisés.elle débute son activité en 2000 avec un capital de 100.000f et s'approvisionne à Cotonou en gros pour revendre auprès des demi grossiste et en détail. ses ventes journalière sont de 10000 à 40000.

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des articles de cassettes audio, des CD et des DVD.

elle aimerait devenir grossiste et ouvrir une grande maison de vente de CD et DVD afin de mieux subvenir aux besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman is a 41-year-old married mother of four children whose ages range from 5 to 17. Three of her children attend school. She began her business in 2000 with 100,000 Fr. worth of capital, and gets her supplies in bulk in Cotonou from public wholesalers and retailers in order to re-sell them. Her daily sales range from 10,000 to 40,000 Fr.

With this loan, she is going to buy audio cassettes, CDs, and DVDs.

She would like to become a wholesaler and open a large store selling CDs and DVDs in order to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Arístides, tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo, él administra una tienda desde hace 10 años, vende a los vecinos de la zona todo lo relacionado artículos de cocina y primera necesidad, cerca está el centro escolar, los estudiantes también le consumen mucha mercadería, él a parte del negocio también es agricultor y normalmente siembra maíz.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono para la milpa, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el desarrollo del cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha, la cual invierte una parte para comercio y para consumo familiar.
Con esta cosecha espera tener para su familia alimentación para unos meses, además de generar ingresos por la venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Arístides, 57, lives with his wife and they have a child. He has had a store for 10 years where he sells basic goods and cooking articles to his neighbors in the area. The school is close by and the students also purchase a lot of merchandise. Aside from the store he is also a farmer and usually plants corn.

He asks for a loan to invest in compost for the corn fields. This loan will help him to improve the development of his crop and get a good harvest. He will invest part of the profit from his harvest in his business, and also in his family.

He hopes this harvest will provide food for his family for a few months, as well as generate income from the sales.

loans.use: to buy compost for his corn crop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 25-year-old single lady living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda,with a dream of building her own house in the next five years. She has been a tailor for two years now and she is impressed with her customer's loyalty despite challenges in limited funds to buy the right quality of cloth materials. She has a passion to become an international fashion designer and she is determined to work towards her goal. Sarah needs the loan to buy cloth to sell.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Las Rosas Del Plan 3000 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento " LAS ROSAS DEL PLAN 3000 " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8  personas en la cual todas son mujeres ,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida,  promotora  de cosméticos , venta de bisutería   todas viven por la  zona del Plan 3000 de ahí el nombre del banco. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Ana, se dedica  a la venta de celulares, tiene 1 hijo, los ingresos que generan sustentan los gastos de su hogar y asimismo para la educación de su hijo ya que dice la Sra., que es su razón de vivir, es una Sra. muy buena responsable y dinámica de ahí que le escogieron como representante del grupo, con el dinero del crédito comprara celulares por mayor y cargadores, esta agradecida con la institución por su apoyo ya que sin ello no podría salir adelante.
texts.en:
The lending bank "Las Rosas del Plan 3000" is in its first cycle with the Institution. It has 8 members, all of whom are women. They have businesses including food sales, cosmetics, and jewelry sales. They all live in the zone known as Plan 3000 and that's how they named their group.  The group was founded at the initiative of 3 members; Ana, who sells cellular phones, has 1 son. The income that she generates covers the costs of their home and also her son's education, who she says is her reason for living. 

Ana is very responsible and dynamic and so she was chosen as the group's representative. With the money from the loan she will buy cell phones and chargers at wholesale. She is very thankful to the institution for its support because without it she wouldn't be able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and chargers in bulk.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, se dedica a la siembra de pipián y maíz, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él trabaja la agricultura desde hace 10 años, esta labor la aprendió en su hogar junto a su padre, en la actualidad le sirve para tener el sustento familiar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para la plantación de pipianes y para el maíz, pues está en época de fertilizar para que puedan dar una buena cosecha.
El propósito de Fidel es tener buenas cosechas y mejorarlas cada año, para que de esta manera también mejoren los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel plants pipian [a squash] and corn. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years and learned the trade at home from his father. This currently serves as his family's livelihood.

He asks for a loan to buy compost for his pipian and squash plantations, since this is the season to fertilize in order to get a good harvest.

Fidel proposes to have good harvests and improve them each year so that he can also improve his family's earnings.

loans.use: to buy compost for the corn and squash plantations.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es:
Patricia, vive con su familia, sus padres y tres hermanos, es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años de edad, sus padres la apoyan mucho y ella se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, de este negocio logra mantener los gastos de su hijo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semillas de marañón, pues son su fuente de ingreso y quiere tener mayor disponibilidad para poder salir a ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es fortalecer su negocio, también continuar generando ingresos para las necesidades personales y de su hijo, con la esperanza de mejorar cada día y ver crecer a su hijo sin limitaciones.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her family - her parents and her 3 brothers. She is a single mother to a 3 year old and her parents help her out a lot. She sells cashews, which allows her to take care of her son.

She is asking for a loan to buy cashew seeds, as this is her source of income and she wants to have more available in order to be able to offer them to her customers.

Her goal with this loan is to strengthen her business and to continue generating income for her and her son's personal needs. She hopes to improve every day and to watch her son grow up without limitations.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Lidia Sabina

texts.es: La señora Lidia es una cliente prácticamente nueva  vive en la zona de Bella Vista ella tiene una hija de 13 años de edad, ella es  mamá sola joven  con bastante ganas de salir adelante  tiene un crédito mas con nosotros la cual sacó para el traspaso de una tienda de lencería en la zona de san miguel la cual le esta hiendo bastante bien puesto que sus ventas han incrementado bastante ella vendía mas ambulando anteriormente en sus productos viene vendiendo mas de  dos años ropa de todo tipo y lencería, por la misma demanda ella requiere mas capital motivo por el cual esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de lencería por mayor, es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lidia is a practically new client who lives in the Bella Vista neighborhood. She has a 13-year-old daughter. She is a young single mother with a great desire to get ahead. She has one other loan with the organization, which she took out for the transfer of a lingerie shop in the San Miguel area, which is going very well for her, since her sales have increased quite a lot. Previously, she sold mostly as a mobile vendor. She has sold her products for more than two years, including lingerie and clothing of all types. Because of the demand for these goods, she needs more capital, and for that reason she is requesting this loan to buy lingerie on a wholesale basis. She is a dynamic and very hard-working woman, and she is grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy lingerie on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is 40 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 16.  In 2001, she established her cow-raising business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Manju plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Betty Isabel

texts.es: Betty D. 39 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo D. 13 años D. edad  en la ciudad D. Barranquilla, en un sitio muy cercano a la zona comercial D. la ciudad, donD. coexisten la interacción D. almacenes, empresas y el comercio informal. Allí  Betty emprendió su negocio D. elaboración D. alimentos dirigido a empleados D. empresas del sector,  con la diversidad  D. sus menús, pero D. esta manera su negocio no tenía sostenibilidad, porque sus clientes, empleados provisionales, se fueron con una gran parte D. su capital. Decidida a sostenerse en el mercado logró idearse la venta D. comidas por porciones, ubicándola  en 2 puntos D. venta, por eso ahora venD. arroz D. liza, (muy autóctono D. Barranquilla) arroz D. pollo, los cuales sirve en hojas D. bijao , acompañados D. huevo cocido y chicha D. maíz, a los clientes D. manera independiente. Cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo y D. su padre para el desempeño diario  del negocio. Ella está en la búsqueda D. crecimiento por eso acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen , con ello ganará descuentos y aumentará su producción, iniciando su proceso D. crecimiento  empresarial. Ella agradece la oportunidad D. fortalecer su negocio, pues   le va a permitir el incremento D. sus ingresos familiares,  para en compañía D. su esposo, lograr el progreso D. sus hijos. Mientras trabaja por cumplir su sueño Betty maneja en su negocio una rotación D. cuentas por cobrar D. 15 días, rotación D. productos terminados D. 1 día, y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 20%, que planea aumentar con su buen desempeño.
texts.en: Betty is 39 years old. She lives with her spouse and her 13-year-old son in the city of Barranquilla, in a location very close to the city's commercial zone, where various stores, businesses and informal traD. all coexist. Betty founded a business preparing food which was aimed at employees of companies in the area, with a diversity of dishes. However, her business was not sustainable in this manner, because her customers were provisional workers, and they left, draining a large part of her capital. Determined to sustain herself in this market, she got the idea to sell food by the portion from 2 points of sale. Thus, she now sells rice with mullet and vegetables (a characteristic local dish in Barranquilla), and chicken and rice, which are served on bijao leaves, accompanied by hard-boiled eggs and a corn-based drink, to her customers in an independent manner. She receives help from her husband and her father in the daily operation of the business. She wants to achieve growth with her business, and for this reason she applied for a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She will use the loan funds to buy raw materials and supplies in greater volume, and thanks to this she will receive discounts and be able to increase her production, initiating her process of entrepreneurial growth. She is grateful for the opportunity to strengthen her business, because it will let her increase her family income, so that together with her husband she can help her children get ahead in life. While she works to achieve her dream, Betty manages her business with a 15-day turnover of accounts receivable, a turnover of 1 day for finished products, and a profit margin on sales of no less than 20%, which she plans to increase with her good performance.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (rice, oil, root vegetables, etc.).

loans.name: Graciela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Graciela, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 14 años de edad, la casa donde viven es familiar y trabaja desde hace 10 años con la venta de mariscos, ofrece a diario a los clientes diferentes clases de pescado.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado fresco como langosta, camarón, corvina, boca colorada entre otras especies que sus clientes consumen, el propósito del financiamiento es comprar todo al contado para luego de las ganancias cubrir las cuotas del préstamo.
Su objetivo en el corto plazo es comprarse un vehículo para transportar la mercadería y de ser posible generar rutas de venta, para poder crecer en clientes y en ventas.
texts.en:
Graciela earns a living selling seafood. She lives with her husband and a son who is 14 years of age. The house where they live is the family home and she has worked for ten years selling seafood, offering daily to her customers various types of products of the sea. 

She currently is seeking a loan to purchase fresh seafood such as lobster, shrimp, sea bass, and red snapper among other species consumed by her customers. The purpose of the financing is to purchase everything with cash so that the earnings then may cover the loan payments. 

Her objective for the short term is to purchase a vehicle for herself in order to transport the merchandise, and if possible to generate sales routes so that she may grow in customers and sales.

loans.use: to purchase fresh seafood such as lobster, shrimp, sea bass, and red snapper.

loans.name: Wladimir Ivan

texts.es: El señor Wladimir es transportista propietario y tiene mas de  20 años con esta actividad, el vive en la ciudad de el alto con toda su familia, su trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta las 22:00 pm, todos los días, junto con su esposa se dividen los gastos familiares, con mucho esfuerzo han logrado sacar a su familia adelante ahora la mayoría de su hijos son profesionales y ayudan con los gastos familiares, don Wladimir sueña con que todos sus hijos puedan ser independientes y tener una profesión, por eso se esfuerza todos los días para que no les falte nada. Don Wladimir solicita crédito en la institución para el mantenimiento de su  movilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Wladimir is an owner and transportation services provider with more than 20 years in this business. He lives in the city of El Alto with his whole family. His work requires much sacrifice given that he works from the early morning hours until 10 p.m. every day. He divides up the family expenses with his wife, and with much effort they have been able to get their family ahead. Now the majority of his children are professionals who help with household expenses. 

Don Wladimir dreams that all his children may be independent and have a profession. To that end he makes the effort every day so they may not lack for anything. 

Don Wladimir seeks a loan with the institution for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Anastacio

texts.es: El Señor José Anastaco tiene 50 años, es la de la comunidad de posoltega. El tiene su negocio que es compra venta y destace de cerdo. Tiene 6 hijos bajo su cargo José le enseña a ellos a ganarse la vida de forma muy honrada.  Solicitó su crédito para la compra de 3 cerdos. En un futuro desea incrementar la compra y venta de cerdos y que sus hijos se preparen pero que también sigan trabajando que con tanto esfuerzo él ha sacado adelante.
texts.en: José Anastaco is 50 years old, and he comes from the community of Posoltega. He engages in buying, selling and slaughtering pigs. He has 6 children whom he is responsible for, and he teaches them to earn their living in a very honorable way. He has requested a loan to buy 3 pigs. In the future he wants to improve the purchase and the selling of pigs; he also wants his children to study but also to keep on working in the activity he has carried out with much effort.

loans.use: To buy 3 pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
From Uganda, Janet is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. Janet rents her home. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Janet sells charcoal at the market. She has done so for over ten years, and she works six days a week. Transportation and seasonality are her main challenges.

Janet has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van, to sell on a wholesale basis only and to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house .

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Villa Lipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA LIPE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Achacachi, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de almuerzo, venta de queso, compra y venta de ganado, tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de químicos. 

La señora Virginia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de venta de queso, que viene trabajando desde hace diez años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las comerciantes de Achacachi y lo comercializará de la feria de la Ceja los días jueves y sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene siete hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Villa Lipe will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional office. It is made up of 11 members and is led by a directive board headed up by Mrs. Virginia. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal association are varied; among them they have: lunch sales, cheese sales, purchase and sale of livestock, neighborhood grocery, potato sales, and chemical sales. 

Mrs. Virginia indicates that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution at the invitation of the loan officer. Currently she has a business selling cheese, which she has been working in for ten years, having learned it from her mother. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy cheese which she will purchase from the merchants of Achacachi and sell at the La Ceja market on Thursdays and Saturdays. This type of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family, since she is a widow and has seven children.

loans.use: to purchase cheese.

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es:
Silvia, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 28 y 24 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. merienda y tortillas, lleva 14 años en el negocio, aprendió por su madre quien le heredo la enseñanza y la clientela.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz y leña, para la preparación D. las tortillas, con esta compra mejorara la inversión con suficiente materia prima.
Para Silvia el objetivo que quiere lograr es crecer con su clientela, para mejorar las ventas y proveer a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her husband and two children, ages 28 and 24.  She sells food and tortillas and has been doing so for 14 years.  She learned the business from her mother and also inherited customers from her.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy corn and firewood to prepare the tortillas.  This will proviD. her with plenty of ingredients.

Silvia’s objective is to grow with her customers so that she can increase her sales and proviD. for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, administra un taller de estructuras metálicas y también venta de chatarra, vive con su esposa y su hija de 15 años de edad, su casa es familiar y el negocio lo tiene desde hace muchos años, heredado por su padre, consiste en el taller y compra y venta de chatarra.
Actualmente necesita un financiamiento para la compra de chatarra que le están ofreciendo, también necesita materiales para el taller como hierro y pintura, con esta inversión está fortaleciendo el negocio y tendrá todo lo necesario para continuar ejerciendo los trabajos.
Su objetivo es, crecer en el taller y poder capacitarse más en la ejecución del trabajo que los clientes le solicitan, con el fin de tener buenas recomendaciones que le permitan aumentar su clientela.
texts.en: Juan manages a workshop of metal structures and also sells scrap metal.  He lives with his wife and his 15-year old daughter.  He has run this business for many years after inheriting it from his father, who also bought and sold scrap metal.  Juan now seeks this credit to buy additional metal inventory, as well as materials and paint for the workshop.  These purchases will greatly strengthen his business, allowing him to expand his metal-working projects and grow his clientele by taking custom orders.

loans.use: to buy metal, materials and paint for his workshop

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: El Sr. Eulogio trabaja en el transporte público, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas, trabaja en una línea  de taxi trufis, con una experiencia superior a 3 años en el rubro y en la misma línea. Vive en la casa de sus Suegros, tiene un hijo, sus esposa por motivos económicos se fue a trabajar a España, El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio a los pasajeros, es una persona muy trabajadora deseando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Eulogio works in public transportation; he’s a member of the combined transportation providers union.  He works in a collective taxi route and has more than three years experience in this line of work and with the same route.  

He lives in his in laws’ house and has a son.  His wife, for economic reasons, moved to Spain to work.

The loan is to provide maintenance to his vehicle because it’s starting to have some mechanical problems that keep him from providing the best service to his customers.  He is a very hard-working person who wants to improve his and his son’s quality of life and is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Idelma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Idelma casada, sus hijos estudiantes, los planes para la  familia es que sus hijos logren una carrera para defenderse ante la vida. Su esposo le ayuda económicamente. Siendo un ingreso más.
El proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Tiene su propio negocio ya que es costurera trabaja por cuentas propias desde hace tiempo en el trabajo no se le ha presentado ninguna dificulta. Iniciándolo con fondos propios ya que elabora productos y los vende. 
El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, la compra de láminas para el portón, soldaduras,  perlines entre otros materiales para la construcción del porche de la casa, así le brindara a su familia comodidad, seguridad.
texts.en:
Idelma is married and her children are students. Her hope for the family is that each of her children will embark on a career, so that they can fend for themselves in life. 

Idelma helps her husband financially, providing an additional income. She has her own business as a self-employed seamstress, and has been working for a long time. She has never experienced any difficulties with her business. Idelma started the business from her own funds, by making products and selling them. 

The project is to improve the infrastructure of their home. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand, slates for the entrance, welding equipment, purlins, and other materials needed for the construction of the porch. This will bring her family security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Fausto Antonio

texts.en: Fausto lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, where he makes a living by selling construction supplies. He has run this business for the last 11 years and owns a dump truck for delivering sand and gravel. Faustino is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to purchase inventory.

loans.use: to purchase gravel, sand, bricks, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su esposo y su hija D. 3 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, tiene un pequeño comedor donD. ofrece alimentos sencillos pero que son del gusto D. muchos clientes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. materiales como carnes, arroz, aceite, queso, embutidos y huevos, dichos materiales son para preparar los diferentes platillos, este préstamo le ayudara mucho, pues tendrá mejor disponibilidad D. alimentos.
El objetivo D. Sonia es aumentar el negocio, con la ayuda D. financiamientos y mejorando su servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She sells food.  She has a small eatery where she provides simple meals that are to the liking of many customers.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies like meat, rice, oil, cheese, cured meats and eggs used to prepare the various dishes.  This loan will help her very much because she’ll have a better supply of food.

Sonia’s objective is to grow her business with help from the loans and to improve service to the customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, cheese, cured meats and eggs for the eatery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products and supplies, such as shampoo, rinses, straighteners, cosmetics and nail polish.

loans.name: Betty Boop Group

texts.es:
Betty Boop es un Grupo Solidario y se encuentra en su 1º ciclo. Esta formado por 7 integrantes muy unidas, las cuales se dedican al comercio, para así sacar adelante a sus familias, y sus reuniones se ubican en la colonia San Miguel en la ciudad  General Escobedo. Ellas eligieron ese nombre para su grupo, ya que además de que les gusta ese personaje se sienten identificadas con el. 

María Dolores es una joven, luchadora e inteligente integrante en el grupo, tiene 23 años, un hijo de 3 años, y vive en unión libre en la ciudad General Escobedo, Nuevo León. María Dolores se dedica a la venta de joyería y zapatos en su casa desde hace aproximádamente 2 años. Ella quiere el crédito para surtir mas mercancía y elevar sus ventas para ayudar a su pareja y poder darle a su hijo una mejor educación, ya que él es su inspiración para seguir adelante.

Una de las metas de María Dolores es seguir con su negocio de venta de joyería y zapatos y hacerse de mas clientela, y en un futuro poner un negocio de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
'Betty Boop' is a solidarity group and this is their first cycle. The group consists of seven close-knit members, all of whom are working in sales in order to provide for their families. Their meetings are held in the San Miguel district in the city of General Escobedo. They chose the name for their group because they like the character, and also feel they can identify with it.

María Dolores is a young, intelligent group member with a fighting spirit. She is 23 years old, has a 3-year-old son and lives with her partner in General Escobedo, Nuevo León. María Dolores has been selling jewelry and shoes from her house for around 2 years. She is asking for this loan so that she can stock more merchandise, increase sales, help her partner, and be able to give her son a better education as he is her inspiration to keep going.

One of María Dolores' goals is to continue her business selling jewelry and shoes, and gain more customers. In the future she hopes to set up a grocery business at home.

loans.use: to invest in jewelry and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar de equipo nuevo para trabajar como es acondicionar un puesto, comprar ollas para cocinar, una estufa espacial para restaurante y mercancía para el negocio. 
Desea superar su ingreso con esta nueva inversión y tener un local estable para su negocio y así tener más clientes quien le puede consumir sus alimentos. 
Con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Juan José se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo con el ingreso de su trabajo en la construcción.
texts.en:
Sara has been engaged in preparing and selling meals for more than four years.
She is requesting a loan to invest it in new equipment for her job, such as installing air conditioning and buying cooking pots, a special restaurant stove and ingredients for her activity.
Through this new investment she wants to increase her income and to own a permanent place for her activity, thus gaining more customers that will eat her meals.
She will repay the loan with the income she will make with her activity, as her husband Juan José pays for family expenses and school fees for their child thanks to his job in constructions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of equipment and ingredients for her activity.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a la venta de refrescos y cosméticos, es una persona de familia, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, con este negocio lleva 10 años, lo aprendió de sus familiares que son comerciantes, de las ganancias a logrado hasta hoy mantener el hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como sodas, jugos y productos de belleza como maquillaje, labiales y prendedores para el cabello.
El préstamo le ayudara para aumentar su negocio, surtiéndolo de mercadería, con ello lograra mantenerse y ofrecer a los clientes nuevos productos que le permitan tener un aumento en las ventas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis sells soft-drinks and cosmetics.  He is a family man living with his wife and two children.  He’s been in this business for 10 years having learned it from family members who are merchants.  To date, profits have made it possible for him to support his household.

He is asking for a loan to buy products like soft-drinks and beauty products like make-up, lipstick and hair clips.

The loan will help him increase business stocking it with merchandise.  He is able to stay in business that way and offer his customers new products that will lead to increased sales and improved living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic containers, bowls, coat hangers, buckets, trash cans, and strainers.

loans.name: Flor De Retamas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE RETAMAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sindolfa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Sindolfa  indica que hace año y medio que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que comprará de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Flor de Retamas" will start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the central office of Senkata.  This group has 10 members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Sindolfa.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses such as: retail trade, production and services.

Sindolfa says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and a half, and joined at the invitation of a loan officer.  Now she works selling woven blankets, an activity that she has been doing for 3 years.

The loan that she will take now will increase her capital; she will purchase wool in the Ceja (a commercial area in El Alto) that she will use to make her products.  She will sell the products via advance orders.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can, as she is married and has 2 children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Biter Oscar

texts.en: Biter lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras where he earns a living by running a small general store. His wife helps him run the shop during the day, which allows him to earn extra income by taking to the road to sell vegetables. He is applying for a loan for Lps. 15,000 to buy additional merchandise to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, candy, beans, rice, eggs, cooking oil, cleaning products and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Verediane

texts.en:
Verediana is a 43-year-old married woman with eight children between the ages of five and seventeen years old. All of her children are in school, and her husband works as a mechanic.

For the past five years Verediana has been selling cassava. She also sells cassava flour, as she owns her own cassava milling machine.

Verediana will use this loan to buy more cassava. Her business has helped her to feed her family, add to her savings and improve the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cassava.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Silvia le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de hacer las protecciones y colocarlas en la casa. Ya que le preocupa  su familia y tiene tres hijos a quienes les quiere dar la protección y seguridad en la casa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasporte como contadora, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
The windows and doors of Silvia's house lack protection.  She is seeking a loan to pay someone to make this protection and install it in her house.  This problem has been bothering her family, and she wants to make her home safer and more secure for her three children.

She plans to pay off the loan out of the wages she gets from her job as a conductor for a transport company, which is the family's source of income.

loans.use: to add protection to her doors and windows.

loans.name: Alex Renieris

texts.en: Alex lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where he makes a living by selling corn. He is the father of three children and has run his small business for the last seven years. Alex is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to purchase a bulk supply of corn. In his free time, Alex raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk supply of corn.

loans.name: Sabina Del Carmen
