texts.es: Sabina es una mujer de 56 años, vive en el reparto modesto palma. Sabina se dedica a una pulpería  ubicada en su vivienda la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los productos que ofrece. Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 30 años y las ganancias obtenidas le permiten darle comodidades a su familia. Es por ello que Sabina desea invertir en su actividad. Solicita el crédito para comprar golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, cremas, leches, pan, detergentes entre otras cosas. Ella solo ha trabajado con nuestra institución y cuenta con un excelente récord de pagos. Estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito.
texts.en:
Sabina is 56 and lives in the Modesto Palma neighborhood of Leon in Nicaragua.  She has a grocery store located in her home, where her clients come to buy her products.  She has had this business for 30 years, and the income from it has allowed her to make her family more comfortable.  It is for this reason that Sabina wants to invest in this business.  

She is seeking a loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, staples, cream, milk, bread, and detergents, among other things.  She has worked only with microfinance partner Fundación Leon and has an excellent payment record.  She is very grateful to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, staples, cream, milk, bread, and detergent, among other things.

loans.name: Godelene

texts.en:
Godelene, 31 years old, is married and has two children ages two and five years old. Both are in school, and her husband is a businessman.

For the past seven years Godelene has run a general store in which she sells rice, beans, cooking oil, and other goods. The profits from this business have helped her improve her family’s standard of living.

With this loan, Godelene will purchase more goods that she will continue to sell for a profit. With future earnings, she hopes to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juana Valentina

texts.en: Juana lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she operates a small general store. She has run the small shop for 15 years and wakes at five each morning to open the store. Juana is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, beans, rice, eggs, condiments, lard, cooking oil, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur.  She is a widow with no children.

For the past seven years, she has sold foodstuffs. This business has enabled her to improve the standards of living for her family.

She requires this loan to purchase more cassava that she will sell at her place of business.  She plans to save the future profits from her business so she can continue to provide for her family in the long term.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell

loans.name: George Mwangi

texts.en:
George is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged seven years old and three years old.  He operates a printing and stationery supply business in Mombasa. He has been in this business for the past three years.  He says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints.

He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy stationery to sell and use in the business. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, put up a business premise where he will avoid renting a place, which is costly. He describes himself as a leader.

loans.use: to purchase stationery to sell and use in his business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she lives with her husband and four children. She makes a living selling used clothing and has run this small business for the past 15 years. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to purchase a bulk supply of used clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk supply of used clothing.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with six children between two months and 12 years old. The youngest child is not yet in school. Her husband works as a moto taxi driver

For the past 10 years, she has sold foodstuffs.  The business has enabled her to feed her children and meet the overall needs of family.

She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sorghum. She will save all future profits and continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like sorghum to sell

loans.name: Gabriel Wafula

texts.en:
Gabriel is 35 years old, single and has one child aged eleven months old. He describes himself as social and God-fearing.

For the past five years Gabriel has run a fruits and vegetables shop in Mombasa. He says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints on his business.

Gabriel is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy mangoes, potatoes and kale to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in future open up other grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, potatoes and kale to sell.

loans.name: Tomasa Leticia

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Tomasa le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía.  
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de ropa para niños, juguetes, y accesorios de bebes como son carriolas, porta bebes, cunas y andadores. No cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que su negocio. 
Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio pagara el crédito, ya es madre soltera y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad y es la una fuente de ingreso que para darle lo necesario y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Tomasa's business is suffering from the fact that her merchandise lacks variety.

She is seeking a loan to invest in buying children's clothes, toys, and baby accessories, such as truckle beds, baby carriers, cribs, and strollers.  She will pay off the loan out of the income from her business.  She is a single mother and has a son to care for.  Her business is her only source of income, which she needs to take of her son and provide him with a good education.

loans.use: invest in buying merchandise.

loans.name: Candelaria Yolanda

texts.es: Candelaria vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 27  años,  en el barrio  20 de Julio, al sur de la ciudad, allí tiene una miscelánea en compañía de su esposo,  donde venden mercancía variada, accesorios, artículos para el hogar etc.,  negocio que inició desde hace 28 años, cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Candelaria además ha aprovechado su punto de contacto con los clientes,  para ofrecer el servicio de telefonía celular, y también vende en los municipios del departamento del Atlántico, mercancías a crédito y cuenta con una cartera muy amplia.   Su sueño es lograr transmitir a sus hijos su capacidad empresarial para que en el futuro tengan su propio negocio. Aunque Candelaria se mueve en el mercado, no tiene el efectivo disponible para comprar en mayor volumen y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará exhibidores y mercancías como vestidos para damas, recipientes plásticos y calzado. Su rotación de inventario es de 32 días, y ella planea continuar ampliando sus ingresos mediante inyecciones de capital de trabajo a las cuales estaría accediendo con sus futuros credikivas, para que ella su esposo y su hijo tengan siempre ingresos productos de este negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives with her husband and 4 children, who are between 13 and 27 years old.  She resides in the 20 de Julio neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla, where she has a general store with her husband.  They sell a variety of merchandise, accessories, things for the home, and so on.  They started this business 28 years ago, when they arrived in Barranquilla.  Candelaria uses her contact with clients to offer a cellphone service and also sells merchandise on credit around the cities of the Atlántico province; she has a large clientele. She hopes to spread the entrepreneurial spirit to her children so that they can have their own businesses in the future.  

Although Candelaria acts as a middleman, she does not have enough money available to buy in large quantities, and this is the reason she is asking for a loan.  She will buy samples and merchandise, such as women's clothing, plastic containers, and shoes.  Her inventory rolls over every 32 days, and she is planning to continue to raise her income by adding working capital with future loans so that she and her husband and son will always be able to make an income from this business.

loans.use: buy samples and merchandise, such as women's clothing, plastic containers, and shoes.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is a 38-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of five and fourteen years old. All of her children are in school, and her husband sells a variety of goods.

For the past twenty years, Victoire has been selling cassava. With her earnings she has been able to develop her business and meet the needs of her family.

Victoire is requesting this loan so that she can purchase more cassava to sell at a profit. With her profits, she will save for her family and pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Del Carmen

texts.es: Nelson Del Carmen es casado trabaja como comerciante de productos varios como cosméticos, ropa, calzado y otros. Solicita su crédito para invertir en una gran cantidad de productos. tambien tiene su otro negocio que es ofrecer los ervicio de tricitaxi, pues este medio lo utiliza para trsnportar su mercaderia.  El se prepara todos los días para salir a ofrecer a sus clientes que lo esperan con los nuevos productos.  Cuenta con apoyo de su esposa quien le brinda la ayuda para obtener nuevos clientes. Nelson está agradecido con este crédito que solicita  pues tiene las esperanzad de mejorar sus ingresos con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en: Nelson Del Carmen is married. He works as a merchant of various products, such as cosmetics, clothes, shoes and more. He is asking for the loan to invest in a large quantity of products. He also has another business offering a bicycle taxi service. He uses the taxi to transport his merchandise. He prepares everyday to go out and offer his customers what they expect in new products. He has his wife's support; she helps him get new customers. Nelson is grateful  for this loan and hopes to improve his income with the earnings he obtains.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes and more.

loans.name: Ines Dilenia

texts.en: Ines lives in Choluteca, Honduras, and is a single mother of three children. She makes a living by selling candy, chewing gum, and snacks, and primarily sells her wares near a local school. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to purchase merchandise. In her spare time, Ines enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase bulk amounts of candy, chewing gum, and snacks.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 41 years old, married, and has three children aged between ten and three years old. He describes himself as business-minded.

For the past fifteen years Titus has run a hardware business in Mombasa. He says his business is profitable with the only major challenge being insufficient capital.

Titus is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy spare auto parts to sell to his customers. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale enterprise. In the future, he sees himself diversifying into real estate, educating his children and building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 43-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with five children between the ages of 16 and 18, some of whom are adopted.  Her husband earns money selling various goods.

For the past five years, she has owned a general store in which she sells toothpaste, shirts, and other goods.  This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family.  

She will use this loan to purchase more goods such as rice and cooking oil that she will sell in her general store for profit.  

With the future profits generated from her business, she plans to feed her children and accumulate savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, sugar etc. to sell

loans.name: Unidas Con Cristo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Elisna is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic, in a rural community. She is the coordinator for her group, named Unidas Con Cristo 1 & 2 (Unite with Christ), a group of Haitian citizens who have made their lives in the Bateyes of the Dominican Republic.
Elisna, her long-term partner, and their four children live together in a Bateyes, which is a small rural community built by sugar companies for their field workers, in the tourist city of La Romana. Elisna also has two more grown children. Despite her difficulties, Elisna makes the most of her opportunities and she operates a miscellaneous sales business, where she sells non-alcoholic beverages such as soda, natural juices, and candies and also underwear, which she sells by walking in the street and from her home. Her most difficult challenge is to own her own house; meanwhile she enjoys working and being at home with her family. 
Elisna is requesting a loan to purchase different products to increase her inventory, such as non-alcoholic beverage, candies, sugar, fruits, and also underwear. She has had two previous loans and has been able to bring changes to her family’s life. She thanks you all for supporting this loan.

loans.use: to buy non-alcoholic beverages, candies, sugar, fruits, and also underwear.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 34-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of three and 10 years old.  All are in school apart from the youngest. His wife works with him at his place of business. 

For the past seven years, he has owned a general store selling beans, rice, mineral water, tea leaves and other items. This business has enabled them to meet the needs of their children and improve their standard of living.

He needs a loan to buy more items to sell in store so that he can continue to make a profit.

With future profits, he will begin building a house to rent out so he can earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy items such as beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
He is a 39-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children who are five and eight years old. Both of his children are in school. He and his wife run a general store.

He has run this store for the past six years selling sugar, rice, beans and other goods. 

He requires this loan so that he can purchase more goods that he will sell for a profit.  

In the future, he will save all his profits in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Yajaira Del Socorro

texts.es: Yajaira de 33 años, convive con su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el reparto modesto palma, Yajaira comenzó su negocio hace 8 años, pues su esposo trabaja como panadero y al mismo tiempo vendía golosinas fue más tarde que deciden juntos establecer una pulpería. Este es su tercer crédito por el que ella se compromete a ser puntual el pago de sus cuotas. Con esto incrementara más productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, pan, golosinas y productos enlatados para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Yajaira is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two minor children. They lives together in their own house located in the community of Modesto Palma. Yajaira started her business 8 years ago. Her husband works as a bread baker and he also sold candies. Later, they decided together to open a small store. This is her third loan and she is committed to making her payments on time. With this, she will increase her basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, candies and canned products to supply her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, milk, bread, candies and canned products.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis, es agricultor, es soltero, vive con sus padres, él tiene 10 años de estar cultivando la tierra, aprendió por medio de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta la fecha no tiene problemas con esta actividad que año a año realiza.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas para tratar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con esta compra podrá dar un buen cuido a la plantación y tendrá menos riesgo que una plaga se la dañe.
Su propósito es ayudar a sus padres con el trabajo diario, poder tener una buena producción para también garantizarle alimentación para un largo plazo, así como también comercializar parte de esta para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer.   He’s single and lives with his parents.  He’s been farming the land for ten years.  He learned from his father and works every day from 6am until 3pm. To date, he’s had no problems with this activity that he carries out year to year.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy manure and herbicides to treat his corn and bean crops.  With this purchase he will be able to provide good care to his plants and have less risk of their being damaged by some infestation.

His goal is to help his parents with his daily work to be able to have a good crop yield and also to guarantee their food supply for a long time as well as to sell part of it to earn profits.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo  de 49 años vive en el barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 27 y 33 años. Allí en su barrio tiene un negocio mediante el cual elabora productos alimenticios, como chuzos de carne, pollo, chorizo o butifarra acompañado de verduras, que venden él y su esposa por volumen a negocios que comercializan comidas rápidas y también directamente ellos, a través de 2   carritos especiales que él mismo diseñó, de 1,10 metros por 60 centímetros,  compuestos por 3 llantas, un espacio delantero donde ubica su asador y parrillas, una vitrina y un deposito ubicado en la parte trasera, donde guardan los insumos. La idea de emprendimiento surgió desde el año 1978 en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  porque Ricardo antes de iniciarlo en esta ciudad,  se dedicaba a viajar de feria en feria por todo el país, y cuando llegó a vender sus productos durante la época del Carnaval, pensó como dice la canción del fallecido maestro Joe Arroyo “En Barranquilla me quedo” y desde entonces se estableció en esta capital, previendo su potencial comercial. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo, pues muchas veces es insuficiente para proveer a los vendedores ambulantes que le solicitan, esta es la razón de su credikiva, con el cual comprará materiales para la preparación de sus productos y también herramientas como asadores, trinches y tenazas, así como recipientes plásticos donde guardar las salsas. Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y con ello una distribuidora de comidas rápidas.
texts.en: Ricardo is 49 years old and he lives in the community of San Roque in the city of Barranquilla. He lives with his wife and he has 2 children, aged 27 and 33. He has a business in his community through which he produces foods, such as meat skewers, chicken, spicy sausages or traditional Peruvian sausages with sides of vegetables. He and his wife sells these products in quantities to businesses that sell fast foods but they also sell directly to the clients. They have 2 special carts which he designed, measuring 1.1 meters by 60 centimeters and bearing three tires. The front section consists of a roaster and grills, a display, and a storage container in the back where they keep their ingredients. The business idea started out in 1978 in the city of Barranquilla. Prior to this business Ricardo used to travel from fair to fair throughout the entire country. But when he came to sell his products during the Carnaval season, he was inspired by the song of the late Joe Arroyo, named "En Barranquilla me quedo", meaning "I will stay in Barranquilla". Since then he has established himself in the capital, having seen the potential for commerce. His greatest challenge is his working capital and often it is insufficient to meet the vendors' demand. And this is the reason why he requests a Kiva loan. He will purchase ingredients with which he will prepare his products and he will also purchase tools such as spits, forks, and tongs. He will also purchase plastic containers where to store the condiments. His greatest dream is to have a house of his own and to set up a fast food supply company.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare his products and to purchase tools such as spits, forks, and tongs.

loans.name: Specoise

texts.en:
Speciose is a 49-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with eight children between the ages of five and 23 years old.  All her children are in school. Her husband works as a driver.

She has been selling beans wholesale for the past 11 years.  This business has enabled her to feed her family and pay for her children’s school fees.  

She needs this loan to buy more beans and stock them for when the market is better in order to maximize her profits.  

With the profits, she will buy different items and turn her store into a general store with more of a variety of goods.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, está casado, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa, poseen casa propia, él es agricultor, dedicado a la siembra de maíz, aprendió de su padre y tiene muchos años de realizar esta labor, de la producción ha logrado garantizar la alimentación de su familia así también ingresos económicos. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres sacos de abono y una bomba plástica  de herbicidas, estos materiales los necesita para aplicarlos al cultivo, con la intención de tener buena cosecha con frutos sanos.
Para Elmer el objetivo que tiene es que a través del financiamiento poder tener los insumos necesarios para trabajar honradamente en la agricultura, logrando mantener a su familia con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Elmer, 22, is married.  He lives with his wife and they have a house of their own.  He’s a farmer who grows corn.  He learned from his father and has been working in this occupation for many years.  From his production he’s been able to feed his family and earn income.

He is asking for a loan to buy three sacks of manure and a plastic herbicide pump.  He needs these materials to apply to the crops with the aim of obtaining a good harvest of healthy fruit.

For Elmer, the goal he has for the loans is to be able to have the necessary supplies to be able to work honorably in farming being able to provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure and a plastic herbicide pump.

loans.name: Ephroca

texts.en:
She is a 27-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children ages one and five years old. The eldest is in school. Her husband is a driver.

For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal and this business has enabled her to feed her family.

She needs a loan to purchase more charcoal that she will sell for a profit.

With future profits, she plans to save so she can purchase a motorcycle for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. Sarah has a business selling silver fish.  She has been in this business for eight years and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market at retail. Sarah has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of silver fish from Kasenyi to Mulago in Kampala. She generates additional income by selling raw cassava. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van, to sell at wholesale only and to build her own house. Sarah lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of fish to sell

loans.name: Candida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cándida, se dedica a la venta de lácteos y tortillas, vive con una hija de 18 años de edad; Ella elabora el queso en su vivienda donde alquila, lleva 10 años de estar en el negocio, lo vende en la zona, porque sale a ofrecerlo o sino los clientes llevan hasta donde ella, a parte de los quesos también vende tortillas por los mediodías.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra le leche para la elaboración de quesos, también maíz y leña para las tortillas, con estos materiales podrá continuar en su negocio y proveer siempre ganancias para su hogar.
El sueño de Cándida es algún día comprarse su propia casa, ya que alquilan con su hija y pues espera dentro de algún tiempo tener la posibilidad de obtenerla.
texts.en:
Candida has a business selling dairy products and tortillas.  She lives with her 18 year-old daughter.  She makes cheese in her rented home.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She sells in her neighborhood.  She goes out to sell the cheese, or her customers come to her, and in addition to the cheese, she also sells tortillas at lunchtime.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk to make her cheese, and also corn and firewood for the tortillas.  With these supplies she will be able to continue with her business and will be able to provide continuous earnings for her household.

Candida's dream is to someday buy her own house, since she is renting with her daughter.  She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to do this.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese, and corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is a 38 year old Rwandan entrepreneur with 4 children between the ages of 7 and 17 years old. All of her kids are in school and her husband works as a house constructor.

For the past 10 years, she has run her own hair salon.  This business has enabled her to pay the school fees for her children and buy her family food. 

She requires this loan so that she can buy equipment for her salon and pay her employees.

With future profits she will save so she can build a house for her business.

loans.use: buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María soltera, sus hijos ya mayores independientes, los planes son seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda. Mujer emprendedora tiene  su propio negocio venta de cosa de horno. Su negocio lo tienes desde hace un tiempo iniciándolo con fondos propios, aumentar las ventas son sus planes a corto plazo.
Con el préstamo construirá la pared del lado lateral de la casa por lo cual requiere comprar los siguientes  materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, piedras canteras, hierro, tablones de maderas, perlines entre otros. Obteniendo mayor protección para su familia.
texts.en:
María is single and her children are now adults.  Her plans are to continue improving the infrastructure of her house.  She is an enterprising woman who has her own business selling baked items.  She started her business with her own funds and has had it for some time now.  Increasing her sales are a part of her short term plans. 

With the loan she will build a wall on the lateral side of her house which will require the purchase of the following construction materials:  cement, sand, gravel, blocks, quarry stones, iron, wood boards, metal beams, etc.  This will help her to better protect her family.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, vive con su familia, es madre de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, es comerciante de ropa, vende en los municipios cercanos a la ciudad, trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y regresa por las tardes a su hogar.
Ella necesita comprar ropa para el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo que cubra la inversión en blusas, faldas, ropa interior, camisas formales y para niños, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la mercadería y tener más surtido el negocio, con la esperanza de que las ventas sean buenas y poder comercializarlas rápido.
Para Doris su principal propósito con el negocio, es tener una fuente estable de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, también poder ahorrar para el futuro de ellos.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her family.  She’s the mother of two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  She is a clothes merchant.  She sells in towns near the city and works every day from very early on returning home in the afternoon.

She needs to buy clothes for the business so is asking for a loan to cover the cost of blouses, skirts, underwear, dress shirts and children’s clothes.  This purchase will help her increase her stock merchandise and have a better selection available hoping thereby that sales will be good and that she’ll sell out quickly.

For Doris, the main reason for the business is to have a stable source of income to cover her children’s needs as well as to save up for their future.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a 34-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of three and seven. All of them are in school, apart from the youngest. Her husband works as a tailor. For the past seven years, Vestine has run a business selling charcoal. Her business has enabled her to support her children and provide for their needs.

Vestine is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the future profits from her loan, she hopes to begin construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es:
Jaime, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su esposa y una hija de un año de edad, viven en casa propia, él aprendió su oficio a través de su padre, tiene ya varios años de estar en el  negocio ya que a por medio de esta actividad logra tener ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente necesita pagar una máquina para que le prepare la tierra rastreándola y comprara 20 sacos abono para el cultivo, él solicita un préstamo para el pago de esta inversión, que le ayudara para llevar a cabo los cultivos.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha de la presente siembra, comercializarla a buen precio y poder solventar algunos gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a farmer and raises livestock.  He lives with his wife and a one-year-old daughter in his own house.  He learned his occupation from his father and has been in business for several years now and it’s his family’s source of income.

At present, he needs a loan to hire a tractor to prepare the soil and to buy 20 sacks of manure for the crops.  He is asking for the loan to pay for this investment since it will help him with the crops.

His goal is to get a good crop yield from this planting, to sell it at a good price and be able to cover some of his family expenses.

loans.use: to lease machinery and to buy 20 sacks of manure.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 52 años, su actividad es la elaboración de pastes de baños. Hace más de 28 años que se dedica a este negocio, no ha sido fácil mantenerlo pues la materia prima con la que ella elabora sus productos están muy caros, la buena administración de su negocio ha hecho que Rosa progrese lentamente pero lo está logrando. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de hilos, tela, esponjas entre otros. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa Argentina is 52 and works sewing bath towels, an activity that she has done for 28 years.  Her business is challenged by high material prices, but  Rosa has been able to grow her sales slowly over time. She seeks this credit to buy cloth, material and padding for her products.  She hopes her profits will allow her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth, material, padding

loans.name: Juan Leonidas

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, fabrica aproximadamente tres hamacas por mes, en su casa de habitación, las comercializa y de ahí mantiene a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio como son hilos de seda de diferentes colores, también necesita comprarse láminas para el techo de su vivienda, con esta compra el préstamo no solo suplirá una necesidad del negocio sino que también una necesidad familiar, para que estén más protegidos.
El propósito de él es mejorar la vivienda actualmente, aunque para el futuro su proyecto es cambiar la estructura de la vivienda, ya que es de lámina y  la quiere reconstruir de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children.  He manufactures hammocks; he makes about three of them per month at home that he sells to support his family.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy supplies for the business like silk cord in assorted colors.  He also needs to buy sheeting for his house’s roof.  With this purchase, the loan won’t only cover his business needs but also a family need so that they will be better protected.

His goal short-term goal is to improve the house although in the long term he wants to redo its structure because it’s made of metal sheeting and he wants to rebuild it with bricks.

loans.use: to buy silk cord in assorted colors and also to buy metal sheeting for the roof.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un commerçant de produits alimentaires qui tient une boutique à l’entrée de la ville. Il est marié et son activité lui permet de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.Il supporte aussi des charges locatives et de paiement de factures d’eau et d’électricité.Il a réussi à acquérir une deuxième boutique à l’intérieur de la ville.Il a déjà obtenu deux prêts de l’IMCEC de 300000F et de 400 000F respectivement.Afin de renforcer son stock son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un troisième prêt de  500 000F pour acheter 50 sacs  de riz, 4 futs d’huile et des produits divers. Son ambition  est d’ouvrir une grande alimentation au bord de la route nationale.
texts.en:
This borrower is a grocer who has a shop at the city's entrance. He is married and his business enables him to support his family. He also covers the rent and the bills for water and electricity. He has succeeded in acquiring a second store inside the city. 

He has already had two loans with the micro-finance institution IMCEC in the amount of 300,000 francs and 400,000 francs respectively. In order to bolster his business fund, he is requesting a third loan of 500,000 francs to buy 50 sacks of rice, 4 casks of oil, and a variety of goods. His ambition is to open a large grocery store along the nation's main road.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of of rice, 4 casks of oil, and various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his home.

loans.name: Sérigne Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui a arrête ses études après un an passé au lycée pour travailler et soutenir sa famille car ses deux parents sont à la retraite.Il s'engage d'abord dans la maçonnerie et réuni un petit fonds qu'il investit ensuite dans le commerce de patte d'arachide, d'huile de palme et de café touba.Il s'approvisionne dans un grand marché sous régional et revend les produits sur le marché local.Aujourd'hui, il arrive à prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, de scolarité et d'habillement des membres de sa famille. Il sollicite un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'IMCEC pour augmenter son fonds de commerce en achetant notamment 200 litres d'huile de palme, 20 seaux de patte d'arachide,50 kg de café touba et du poisson séché. Les bénéfices tirés de la vente de ces produits l'aideront beaucoup à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison mais aussi et surtout d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits agricole dans sa localité.
texts.en: The borrower is a young single man who stopped his studies after the first year of high school in order to work and support his family because both of his parents are retired. He first worked as a mason and gathered a small amount of money which he has invested in selling peanut paste, palm oil and café touba (a spiced coffee beverage very popular in Senegal). He buys his supplies in a large market in his region and resells them at the local market. Today, he is able to support his family's needs for food, sanitation, education and clothing. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 CFA francs from IMCEC in order to increase his working capital to by 200 liters of palm oil, 20 buckets of peanut paste, 50 kg of café touba and dried fish. The profits gained from the sale of these products will help him a lot in satisfying the needs of his family. His ambition is to build his own house, but especially to open a large store to sell agricultural products in his area.

loans.use: To buy 200 liters of palm oil, 20 buckets of peanut paste, 50 kg of coffee and dried fish

loans.name: Marta Corina

texts.es:
Marta, es una mujer trabajadora, vive con su esposo, una hija y dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, con este negocio ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, posee mucha clientela, pues da un buen servicio, venD. D. lunes a sábado, este negocio lo heredo D. su madre.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. leña, ya que por la época del invierno necesita comprar y almacenarla para que este seca, pues ella trabaja solamente con leña para el cocimiento D. las tortillas, esta compra le ayudara mucho porque tendrá una buena cantidad hasta que finalice en invierno.  
Su propósito es fortalecer el negocio, trabajar ordenadamente con los préstamos y sacar adelante sus ventas, generando mayores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and two grandchildren. Marta sells tortillas so that her family can get ahead. She has many customers to whom she provides good service. Marta sells from Monday to Saturday. She inherited this business from her mother.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy firewood. During the winter season, she needs to buy and store the wood so that it will remain dry. She only uses wood when cooking the tortillas. This purchase will be a great help because she will have enough wood to last her through the winter.

Her goals are to strengthen her business, work with the loans in an orderly fashion, succeed with her sales, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for cooking tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 bins of mangoes.

loans.name: Lilliam Maria

texts.es: Lilliam Maria se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene la experiencia de tratar con sus clientes a diario. ella comenzó cuando se separo de su esposo y tuvo que trabajar para mantener a su hija de 11 años, a pesar que al inicio no fue fácil ha logrado superar los tropiezos que ha tenido ha mantenido su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, bolsos, ropa en general, toalla, sabanas, cremas y perfumes.
texts.en:
Lilliam Maria sells general merchandise.  She has over five years of experience of dealing with her customers every day.

She started when she separated from her husband.  She had to work to support her 11 year old daughter.  In spite of the fact that in the beginning it was not easy, she has managed to overcome the obstacles she had.  She has sustained her business activity.

This loan is to buy shoes, bags, general clothing, towels, sheets, creams, and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, general clothing, towels, sheets, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Amparo Dicenia

texts.en: Amparo lives in Choluteca, Honduras, with her three children. For the past 15 years she has made a living by running a small general store. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL to purchase merchandise for her store. In her free time, Amparo enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, beans, rice, eggs, lard, cooking oil, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Paula Mercedes

texts.es:
Paula de 46 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, es madre de dos hijos, su nivel académico es básico solo llego hasta segundo grado de primaria. Ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de de tortillas. Aprendió este oficio por medio de su madre quien  le enseño a elaborar y vender las tortillas, ella 20 años vendiendo de forma independiente, su hija mayor le ayuda y su esposo en sus ratos libres también la apoya además de los ingresos que el lleva pues trabaja de forma independiente, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y vende en todo su vecindario.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar  6 quintales de maíz  y leña para elaborar sus tortillas. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir la materia prima más fácilmente y aun precio menor pues podrá comprar más y un poco mas barato. Uno de sus proyecto que quiere realizar con las ganancia que obtenga es mejorar la condiciones de su local quiere ponerle piso y cambiar el techo para que ya no se le introduzca  agua durante el invierno.
texts.en:
Paula is 46 years old and lives in the city of León. She is the mother of two children and has a basic education since she completed school only through the second grade. Paula is a merchant who sells tortillas. She learned this trade from her mother, who taught her how to make and sells tortillas. Paula has worked independently for 20 years. Her eldest daughter is her assistant and her husband helps out in his spare time. With the support she receives and the income she generates, Paula is able to continue working independently. Her business is located in her home and she sells all over her neighborhood.

Paula is requesting a loan to buy six “quintales” (1 quintal = 46 kg) of corn and firewood for making tortillas. With this investment, she will have the materials that make her job easier. By buying in bulk, she will also be able to get a cheaper price. One of the projects that she will start is to use her earnings to improve the conditions of her shop. Paula wants to install a floor and replace the roof so that water will not seep through during the winter.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Maréme

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse a démarré ses activités de location de chaises et de bâche pour les manifestations sociales sur un premier prêt de l’IMCEC. Ce prêt de 100000F a servi à l’achat de 25 chaises dont les produits de la location lui ont permis de solliciter plus tard deux autres prêts de 150000F chacun.Aujourd’hui, elle dispose de 3 bâches et de 100 chaises et a construit un magasin de stockage dans son domicile.Elle possède également une machine à coudre qui lui permet de varier ses sources de revenus et de mieux prendre en charge ses cinq enfants dont les trois fréquentent l’école.Elle sollicite actuellement un autre prêt pour terminer son magasin et augmenter son stock de chaises. Elle ambitionne de construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en: This borrower got started with her business renting out chairs and tarps for social gatherings using her first loan from IMCEC. That loan of 100,000 F allowed her to buy 25 chairs and renting those out enabled her to ask for two further loans of 150,000 F each. Today she owns three tarps and 100 chairs and has built a storeroom in her domicile. She also owns a sewing machine which allows her to vary her income sources so that she can better support her five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. She is now asking for another loan to finish off her storeroom and add to her stock of chairs. She hopes later on to build her own house.

loans.use: finish her storeroom and add to her stock of chairs.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana está casada, su esposo le ayuda económicamente, su hijo lo tiene estudiando, mujer trabajadora tiene su propio negoció desde hace tiempo vende ropa de variedad, iniciándolo con fondos de micro créditos.  Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y su nivel de vida.
Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: blusas, para damas, niños y caballeros, pantalones, camisolas, ropa interior entre otros productos de uso personales.  Obtendrá mayor variedad captando nuevas clientelas.  
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is married and she splits household expenses with her husband.  Her son is in school.  She is a hard-working woman who has operated her own clothing business for several years, a business she started with microloans.  Her goal is to improve her house and her standard of living.  She will use this loan to buy clothing for men, women and children--blouses, trousers, camisoles and underwear--and other merchandise that she will resell.  A wider range of products will allow her to pick up new customers.
She is grateful to the bank for supporting the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un mécanicien auto. Il a son atelier de réparation mécanique prés de la route nationale et a implanté, avec un prêt de 150000F de l’IMCEC, une canT. de vente de pièces détachées à coté de son atelier. Ces deux activités très complémentaires lui assurent des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille notamment de ses trois enfants tous inscrits dans des établissements d’enseignement privés. Il sollicite un autre prêt de 400000f afin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce en achetant 4 cartons d’huile moteur , 2 cartons d’huile moto, 30 croix, 1 carton de cartouches et 1 carton de bougies. Son ambition est de construire un magasin de vente en gros de pièces détachées complètes.
texts.en:
This borrower is an auto mechanic. He has a repair shop near the national road. Next to his workshop, he has set up, with a loan of 150,000 francs from the micro-finance institution IMCEC, a stall selling replacement parts. These two businesses complement each other very well and ensure revenues substantial enough to support his family, especially his three children, who are all enrolled in private schools. 

He is requesting another loan of 400,000 francs to increase her working capital by buying 4 boxes of motor oil, 2 boxes of motorbike oil, 30 crosses, a box of cartridges, and a box of spark plugs. His ambition is to build a wholesale store selling complete replacement parts.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of of motor oil, 2 boxes of motorbike oil, 30 crosses, a box of cartridges, and a box of sparkplugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 350 kg of seeds and 10 pouches of fertilizer and to lease horses for plowing

loans.name: Gilbert Coly

texts.fr: L’emprunteur pratique l’activité de soudure depuis dix ans. Il fait simultanément de l’élevage depuis cinq ans grâce à des financements de l’IMCEC. Ces deux activités lui assurent la prise en charge de son épouse et de ses six enfants dont quatre sont des élèves. Il sollicite actuellement un prêt de 300 000Fpour l’achat de 2 vaches. Au bout de deux mois, il revendra ces vaches bien engraissées sur le marché local  afin d’en tirer le maximum de revenus. Les bénéfices de l’opération allégeront considérablement ses charges familiales et personnelles. Il ambitionne d’élargir son atelier par la fabrication et l’exposition des produits de son atelier de soudure.
texts.en:
This borrower has been operating a welding business for six years. He has simultaneously raised livestock for five years, thanks to financing from the micro-finance institution IMCEC. These two businesses ensure that he can support his wife and six children, of whom four are students. 

He is currently requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy two cows. After two months, he will sell them well-fattened at the local market to derive the maximum revenues. The profits from the operation will considerably alleviate his personal and family expenses. His ambition is to expand by making and displaying the products from his welding shop.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Oscar Agusto

texts.es: El señor Oscar, es habitante del municipio de la concepción, junto a su esposa la cual actualmente labora en una casa privada para poyar con los gastos del hogar,  los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda ya que el zinc esta deteriorado por las cenizas del volcán, don Oscar desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de café, la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden la plantación ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos. Agradece Afodenic  que atrávez de fondo Kiva se lo otorga un financiamiento para inducir en tiempo y forma el cultivo ya que si esto no fuese posible la producción se perdería.
texts.en: Sr. Oscar lives with his wife in the town of Concepcion.  His wife works as a cleaner and they share household costs.  Don Oscar wants to repair the house where they live because the roof of the house has been damaged by volcano ash.  Don Oscar has made a living from coffee farming for several years.  He has to contend with the plant diseases that destroy his crop because he doesn't have the fertilizers and other supplies that he needs for a healthy crop.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for delivering the funding he needs quickly because without the extra funds he would lose his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Seyni

texts.fr: Implantée en face de la route nationale, la petite pièce qui sert d’atelier de couture à l’emprunteur devient de plus en plus étroite. Ayant démarré avec une seule machine, ce dernier en dispose actuellement de  trois. Il est marié et a huit enfants  qui fréquentent tous l’école. L’emprunteur exerce sa profession depuis prés de 24 ans. Il est assisté de deux apprentis à qui il apprend le métier. Parallèlement à son travail, il pratique durant l’hivernage l’agriculture et l’élevage. Les revenus tirés de ces activités lui permettent de s’occuper de sa famille. Il a déjà obtenu et rembourse six prêts à l’IMCEC et sollicite un autre prêt de  200000F destiné à l’achat d’une machine à coudre cornière pour la diversification des ses produits. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un grand magasin de couture et de mieux renforcer son équipement.
texts.en: Facing the national road, the small room set up as a tailor's shop for this borrower is becoming more and more cramped. Having started with a single machine, he currently has three of them. He is married and has eight children, who all attend school. This borrower has been working in this trade for nearly 24 years. He is attended by two apprentices whom he taught how to sew. Concurrently with his trade, he works in agriculture and livestock farming during the winter. The revenues derived from these businesses enable him to take care of his family. He has already had six loans with the IMCEC and has repaid them. He is requesting another loan of 200,000 francs for buying a cornière sewing machine, so as to diversify his products. His ambition is to open a large sewing store and to boost his supplies further.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Leyla Marina

texts.en: Leyla lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras, with her husband. For the past six years she has made a living by running a small convenience shop out of her home. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to purchase merchandise for the store. Leyla is a returning client and has used previous loans to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, beans, rice, eggs, lard, cooking oil, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Ana Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Ana Alejandra y su esposo el señor Jesus Ramón son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos. 
Solicitan un préstamo para poder comprar de los uniformes (ropa y zapatos) y útiles escolares que son libros, cuadernos, lapice, carpetas y mochilas. No cuentan con el dinero necesario para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y no pierdan este siclo escolar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe el señor Jesus Ramón de su trabajo en una fábrica como técnico, ya que la señora Ana Alejandra de encargas de cuidar y atender a la familia.
texts.en: Sra. Ana Alejandra and her husband, Sr. Jesus Ramon, have two children.  They are applying for a loan so that they can buy school uniforms (clothing and shoes) and other school supplies--books, notebooks, pencils, binders and backpacks, for example.  They don't want their children to miss the coming school-year, but they don't have enough money now to send them.  They plan to repay the loan from Sr. Jesus Ramon's earnings from his job at a factory.  Sra. Ana Alejandra works at home, tending the family.

loans.use: to pay for school uniforms and other school-related expenses.

loans.name: Willian Antonio

texts.es:
Willian de 32 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Inicio su negocio con ayuda de su esposa (aparece en la foto), con esfuerzo y dedicación alcanzaron a surtir la tienda con diferentes víveres. 

Poco a poco ha mejorado los ingresos de su familia. Tiene muchas aspiraciones por eso trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h30 todos los días. Vende enlatados, granos, bebidas, confites, dulces etc. Con el préstamo quiere continuar trabajando y comprar confites, enlatados, bebidas para su tienda.
texts.en:
Willian, age 32, is a hardworking gentleman who has a small store at the front of his house. He started this business with the help of his wife (who also appears in the photo). Through their effort and dedication, they were able to stock their store with different food products.

Little by little, the income for Willian’s family has improved. He has many aspirations, so he works every day from 7am to 10:30pm. Willian sells canned goods, grain, beverages, candy, sweets, and other items. With this loan, he wants to continue working and buy candy, canned goods, and beverages for his store.

loans.use: to purchase candy, canned goods, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, vive con su hijo y su esposa, administra un mini taller de costuras, tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la sastrería y aprendió cuando era ayudante de un taller, ha logrado ganar clientela y es de este negocio que cubre las necesidades de su familia.
Actualmente necesita comprar materiales para el taller, por lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en telas, hilos, botones, broches, y ciper, con este préstamo podre tener el inventario surtido de los materiales necesarios para atender cualquier trabajo.
El objetivo de Martin es que su taller de sastrería se mantenga y así continuar en el oficio que tanto aprecia y que hasta el momento le ha dado todo lo necesario para él y su familia, también tiene el deseo de mejorar sus trabajos capacitándose.
texts.en:
Martin lives with his wife and child. He manages a small sewing workshop and has 25 years of experience working as a tailor. Martin learned this trade when he was an assistant at another workshop. He has built up a customer base and his business enables him to provide for the needs of his family.

At the moment, he needs to buy materials for his workshop. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in fabrics, thread, buttons, snaps, and zippers. With this loan, he will be stocked with the necessary materials to perform any job.

Martin’s goal is to maintain his tailoring shop and continue in his trade. He appreciates everything that has been given to him and his family so far. Martin also hopes to improve his work-related knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, snaps, and zippers.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su compañera de vida, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder establecer una pulpería, don Juan desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación que se le presenta  es el robo del producto ya que por la noches no tiene una persona que le cuide el cultivo y sobre todo este carece de insumos ya que la coloración no esta  muy apropiada , Agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva por el apoyo que le brinda  ya que con las venta pueden pagar en tiempo y forma .
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe where he lives with his life partner. The plans for his family include improving their living conditions and establishing a grocery store. Don Juan has been growing pineapple for several years. The greatest challenge he faces is people stealing his product at night because he does not have anyone to look after his crops. He also lacks farming supplies necessary for his crops to attain the appropriate color.

Juan is grateful to AFODENIC for the support it has provided by supplying Kiva funds. Through his sales, he will be able to repay on time and according to terms.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria , es habitante del municipio de  Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo que trabaja para poyarle con los gastos de la casa ya que tienen hijos que actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de y poder brindarle estudios a sus pequeños pata que logren realizar una carrera profesional , doña Maria  desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo  de piña , la mayor  afectación que se le presenta son las plangas que invaden el cultivo ,  lo cual provoca una mala cosecha y grandes pérdidas del producto . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva , ya que siendo una persona humilde y de bajos recursos la apoyen para poder mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe, where she lives with her husband who helps with the household expenses. They have children who are currently in school. The plans for their family are to improve their conditions and to provide an education for their little ones so that they can pursue a professional degree. Doña Maria has been growing pineapple for several years. Her greatest challenge is when diseases impact her crops, which results in a bad harvest and large product losses.

Maria is grateful for the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds. She is a modest person with limited resources, so this support will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Cayetano Samuel

texts.es: El señor Cayetano, de 70 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Jinotega, casado y con dos hijos de 24 y 21 años respectivamente, se dedica actualmente a la venta de botas y fajas de cuero desde hace 24 años. Su primer negocio fue la venta de zapatos pero decidió en conjunto con su familia ingresar nuevos productos a su negocio como son las faja y botas. ÈL solicitó su crédito para comprar diferentes estilos de fajas y botas ya que es un producto de alta rotación en el mercado y así ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad y variedad. El señor Cayetano nos cuenta que da a conocer su producto en la feria Expica – Managua, ya que mediante ésta obtiene mejores ganancias. Desea ampliar más su taller con más trabajadores y así tener más productos en su inventario. Su próxima meta es solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertir más a su negocio.
texts.en:
Cayetano, 70, was born in the city of Jinotega.  He is married and has two grown children, 24 and 21 years old respectively.  He has sold leather boots and belts for the past 24 years.
His first business was selling shoes but he decided, together with his family, to include new products such as belts and boots.  He requested a loan to buy different styles of belts and boots and now  these are top sellers in the market and he can offer his customers better quality and variety. 
Cayetano tells us that he learned about his products in the Expica-Managua Market and this is the way he gets a higher income.  He wishes to enlarge his shop and add more workers and thus have more products in his inventory.  His next goal is to request new financing to invest more in his business.

loans.use: to buy belts and boots

loans.name: Cecilia Maribel

texts.es:
Cecilia de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de joyería y ropa. Empezó hace 13 años atrás vendiendo bisutería y ropa poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad sigue vendiendo ropa pero con la variedad de joyas. 

Trabaja desde las 14h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Las joyas están a un valor aproximado de $ 25- $ 30.00, la ropa tiene un aproximado de $ 10.00 hasta $ 30.00. Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo joyería y ropa y así darle una mejor economía a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 34 years old, hardworking, and sells jewelry and clothes. 13 years ago she started by selling jewelry and clothes. Little by little the amount of merchandise she sold grew. At the moment she continues to sell clothes however she now sells a variety of jewelry.

Everyday she woks from 2 a.m. to 7 p.m. The price range for her jewelry is $25.00 - $30.00 and her clothes $10.00 - $30.00. She has many aspirations with her business which is why she wants to use the loan to buy jewlery and clothes and be able to offer her 3 children better financial support.

loans.use: buy jewelry and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk, bread, canned goods, soups, and detergents.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Doña Salvadora una humilde comerciante de 64 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí,es viuda, tiene 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a elaborar tortillas y es costurera al mismo tiempo. Inicio en el negocio de elaboración de tortillas hace 40 años , también se dedico a aprender costura de esta manera ha sobrevivido ella y sus hijos  durante todo este tiempo , su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación , ella misma las vende y elabora pero ya no sale a vender pues por su edad no puede recorrer grandes distancias como antes ,vender sus tortillas a los clientes que habitan alrededor de su vecindario . 
Ella requiere el préstamo para poder comprar maíz  y leña al por mayor y comprar dos puertas para su casa ya que con la lluvias se le introduce agua en su cocina que es donde tiene su venta de tortillas. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir mas fácilmente materia prima para  trabajar, mejorar sus ingresos y hacerles mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar y negocio. Desea invertir para su negocio de costura y mantener el negocio de ventas de tortillas y seguir trabajando hasta donde Dios Le permita.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salvadora is a humble seller who is 65 years old, lives in Estelí city, widowed, and has 5 children. She makes tortillas and is a seamstress at the same time. She started her tortilla making business 40 years ago. She also learned how to sew and was able to help herself and her children survive all of this time with these jobs. She has her business in her home. She her products and sells them but no longer goes out to sell them since she can no longer walk long distances like before. She sells them to clients who live around her neighborhood. 
She is requesting the loan to buy maiz and wholesale firewood. She also wishes to buy two doors for her home since rainwater gets into her kitchen where she makes her tortillas. With the loan she will be able to buy essential materials for her job, increase profits, and improve her home and business's infrastructure. She wishes to invest in her sewing and tortilla businesses and continue working where God will permit her.

loans.use: buy maiz, wholesale firewood, and two doors for her home.

loans.name: Vanessa Lucia

texts.es:
Vanessa casada su esposo le apoya con los gasto de la casa, trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace un tiempo, sus proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda, por seguridad requiere construir el porche de la casa. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques, clavos, alambre, láminas de zinc, golosa, perlines entre otros materiales. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo  para realizar parte de su proyecto. Obteniendo la comodidad y protección que necesita.
texts.en:
Vanessa is married. Her husband helps with the household expenses through his job working for a private company, where he has been at for some time. Their plans include improving the infrastructure of their home. For safety reasons, they need to build a porch for their house.

With this loan, Vanessa will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, blocks, nails, wire, tin sheets, bolts, crossbeams, and other materials. She is grateful to AFODENIC for the support it has provided so that she can complete part of her project. This will help her family attain a necessary level of comfort and protection.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil pumps, gas leak detectors, refrigerants, and other tools.

loans.name: Joyas Del Pacífico Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Joyas del Pacífico” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran repostería, peluquería, preparación de comida rápida, artesanía en cuero, amasandería, bazar, kiosco, carnicería, venta de tejidos, alimento para perro, productos congelados, venta de ropa nueva, ropa usada y venta de tejidos. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Jacqueline presidenta del banco comunal se encuentra en la segunda fila del grupo, vistiendo un polerón de color lila, con un pañuelo color café y su cabello es de color negro, se dedica al servicio de peluquería desde hace 4 años. La dinámica de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes a domicilio, un día a la semana trabaja en su misma casa, donde llegan sus clientes directamente, sin la necesidad de solicitar hora y los fines de semana también atiende en su domicilio, pero realiza peinados para eventos.
Sus insumos los compra en centros comerciales y liquidadoras de productos de belleza. 
Con el crédito comprará un fogón, un tubo de gas e insumos para su negocio. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda instalar su peluquería. Jacqueline realizó un curso de peluquería y se especializó en corte para mujeres y hombres.
Jacqueline vive junto a su marido y sus 2 hijas de 24 y 14 años de edad, además con su yerno y nieto de 10 meses de edad. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que disfruta mucho lo que hace.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, disfruta de la convivencia con los demás integrantes del grupo del banco comunal, ya que también se respetan los valores de la institución. Comenta que las capacitaciones y el crédito han aportado mucho para su negocio. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Joyas del Pacífico” ["Jewels of the Pacific"]. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs, who dedicate themselves to diverse types of businesses, including pastry making, hairdressing, fast food preparation, leather handicrafts, bakery, general store, kiosk, butcher shop, woven fabric sales, dog food, frozen products, new clothing sales, and used clothing and woven fabric sales, All of them live in the city of Valparaíso.

Jacqueline, the president of the communal bank, can be seen in the second row of the group, with black hair and wearing a light purple sweater with a brown scarf. She has worked providing hairdressing services for 4 years. The way her business works is that she serves her customers at their homes, although one day a week she works in her own home, where customers can come to her directly without needing to make an appointment. On weekends she also provides services in her home, styling customers' hair for special occasions. 

She buys her supplies at shopping centers and from beauty product liquidators. With the loan, she will buy a heater, a gas connection and supplies for her business. 
 
Her goal is to have a permanent shop where she can install her beauty salon. Jacqueline has studied hairstyling, and she specialized in haircuts for women and men. 

Jacqueline lives with her husband and her two daughters, aged 24 and 14, in addition to her son-in-law and her 10-month-old grandson.

She is motivated to continue with her business because she enjoys what she does very much. She is very happy and grateful for the services provided by the Fondo Esperanza [Hope Fund], and she enjoys the camaraderie with the other group members, since they also respect the institution's values. She comments that the training sessions and the loan have been a great help for her business. 

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the seat of the country's legislative branch. It is the nation's most important port, offering a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy a heater, a gas connection and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anita Alexandra

texts.es:
Anita es una mujer  trabajadora que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Hace 15 años atrás ha trabajado para mejorar la vida de sus hijos a trabajado y a invertido dinero en víveres de primera necesidad para tener una tienda acorde a los requerimientos de sus clientes. 

Trabaja desde las 08h35 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, enlatados, granos, etc. En el futuro quiere seguir con su tienda y que su familia tenga buena salud.
texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking woman who with work and dedication has been able to have a small store in the back of her house. She has worked for 15 years to improve her children's lives and has invested money in basic necessity groceries to fill her customers' needs.  

She works from de 8:35 a.m. until  10:00 p.m. She aspires to a lot in her business and that is why she wants a loan to buy products of basic necessity such as rice, canned goods, grains, etc. In the future, she wants to continue with her store and for her family to be in good health..

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods and grains.

loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza Del Pechiche. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive a la señora Cecilia, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de 13, 11 y 8 años, las  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  la menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor. Ella lleva con su esposo más de 15 años pero recién se caso hace 3 meses.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta  de zapatos y de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella recorre puerta a puerta tres días a la semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito con la finalidad de tener más ventas y luego  cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene dos años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. También cría pollos en su casa para lo cual ha construido una pequeña granja.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y alimento para pollos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "La Union Hace La Fuerza del Pechiche" of the canton of Rocafuerte meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals and they are renowned throughout the entire country.

This is where Cecilia lives. She is 32 years old, married, and from her relationship she has three daughters, aged 13, 11, and 8. The two eldest are in high school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a master builder. She has been with her husband for more than 15 years but they married only 3 months ago. 

Our friend sells shoes and Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She travels from door to door three days per week offering her products to her clients, completing the sales on credit with the goal of making more sales. She collects payments every weekend. She has been in business for two years and it has gone very well for her. She also raises poultry in her house on a small coop she had built.

This loan will be used to purchase shoes, perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and poultry feed. This is her third loan cycle with her communal bank and she appreciates it for the easy payments.

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Cintya Carola

texts.es: Cintya es una señorita que actualmente vive en el departamento de Cochabamba provincia Cercado, ella vivía en el Departamento de La Paz  con su familia y para buscar una condición de vida mejor se vinieron a vivir a la ciudad de Cochabamba, ellos llegaron a la ciudad y empezaron a buscar trabajo o ver algún negocio, ella al venirse de su pueblo ya no pudo estudiar mas, ahora ella trabaja comprando materiales de ferretería de las ferias populares y mayoristas de la ciudad de Oruro, y ella vende sus productos ofreciendo ferretería por ferretería o talleres de carpintería, ella solicita un préstamo para tener más capital y poder comprar más mercadería a un precio mas económico y asi poder ayudar a su familia para montar un pequeño taller familiar, y teniendo ya un negocio familiar poder terminar de estudiar, y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Cinthya is a young woman who is presently living in the department of Cochabamba,  province of Cercado. She used to live in the department of La Paz with her family. To seek a better quality of life they came to live in the city of Cochabamba. They arrived in the city and started to look for work or start a business. When she came from her town she was unable to study anymore. She works now buying hardware products from popular markets and wholesalers from the city of Oruro, and she sells her products, offering the hardware to other hardware store or carpentry workshops. She is asking for a loan to have more capital and be able to buy more merchandise at a lower price. In this way, she can help her family open a small family workshop. With a family business she will be able to finish her studies and become someone in life.

loans.use: to increase her investment in working capital.

loans.name: Paula Lorena

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza Del Pechiche. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 46 años de edad  y  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores y uno de 17 años que estudia en el colegio y es el que aun vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor. Este es su cuarto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le sacan de muchos apuros económicos.

Ella con la finalidad de ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y al ver que a su marido no le alcanzaban para los gastos del hogar hace mas de 10 años decidió poner un negocio de venta de mariscos y legumbres, esta actividad la realiza todos los domingos en el mercado de Rocafuerte en la cual tiene su pequeño puesto, los demás días vende pescado por el lugar donde ella habita. El pescado lo compra en las playas de Crucita o en Los Arenales.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, legumbres y otros mariscos.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank La Unión Hace La Fuerza Del Pechiche meet bimonthly in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known all over the country for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals.  

This is where Señora Paula lives.  She is 46 years old and has three children with her common law husband.  Two of her children are adults and the third is 17 years old and is attending school.  Her husband is a farmer.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank.  She likes the loans because they help her financially.  Ten years ago she decided to start her own business selling seafood and vegetables to help her children with their studies and help her husband cover the household expenses.  She works every Sunday in the Rocafuerte market where she has a small stand.  The other days of the week she sells fish out of her house.  She buys the fish on the Crucita beaches or in Los Arenales.  

She will use this loan to buy fish, vegetables, and other seafood.  Her dream is to have a well-built house.

loans.use: buy fish, vegetables, and other seafood.

loans.name: Rodrigo Abel

texts.es: Rodrigo Abel   es un joven que vive en el departamento de Cochabamba provincia Cercado es soltero y vive aun con sus papas, el no pudo terminar de estudiar por la situación económica de su familia a muy corta edad tuvo que empezar a trabajar para poder mantener y ayudar a su familia, él vive en una pequeña urbanización al este de la ciudad la cual está empezando a desarrollarse aún no cuentan con caminos definidos y durante el día solo ingresan dos movilidades de transporte publico la cual provoca que él no pueda llegar a su trabajo a tiempo. El trabaja en una tienda de carpintería de aluminio que se encuentra a 1 hora de su casa en el centro de la ciudad, el solicita un crédito para poder comprarse una motocicleta y asi poder llegar a tiempo a su trabajo y por las tardes irse temprano a casa para poder ayudar en las labores del hogar a su mamá.
texts.en: Rodrigo Abel is a young man who lives in the department of Cochabamba, province of Cercado. He is single and still lives with his parents. He wasn't able to finish his studies due to his family's financial situation. He had to start working at a very young age in able to support and help his family. He lives in a small neighborhood of this city which is still beginning to develop and still doesn't have defined streets. During the day there are only two public buses and that means that he can't get to his job on time. He works in a carpentry workshop that works with aluminum. It is an hour from his house in the city center. He is asking for the loan to be able to buy a motorcycle and thus be able to get to his job on time and get hoe early in the afternoon to help his mother with the housework.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to be able to get to work.
