loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia, who is 36 years old, is married to a farmer named Roderick. Together, they raise their two children in their peaceful village in Cagayan Province. Sylvia wants a life that is comfortable and prosperous so with Roderick, they manage well their livelihood in farming hand in hand. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for land cultivation and to purchase the seeds, fertilizers and insecticides she needs for farming. This loan, she believes will be a great help towards a better yield.

Sylvia aspires that someday, she will able to continuously send her children to school until college. They'd be very grateful if that happens, said Sylvia.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 49 years old and married to Rael who is a farmer. They are blessed with seven children. He has been a carpenter for four years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. Samuel will use the loan to buy timber for making furniture and carpentry tools. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is concentrated more on his children’s education.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Gloria has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 26 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She earns a living by selling goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on. This is her second successful year in this business. Her business is well organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her. 

Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on for resale. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business, and renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell, such as lotions, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Phork

texts.en: Mr. Phork is an older woman who has been living in the Siem Reap Province. Mr. Phork has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and he uses his knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Mr. Phork also travels to sell his medicine by walking around her community. He now has four single kids who live with him. Aside this, Mr. Phork also assists his wife with planting a few crops on their existing farmland. The coming rainfall is good for their crops. However, Mr. Phork and his wife don’t have capital yet to use on their farm. So, Mr. Phork is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing insecticides and potato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Winlight

texts.en:
Winlight is 23 years old and supports his mother. He buys and sells second-hand clothing. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6000.

Winlight has borrowed a loan of KES10,000 from KADET. This being his first loan, he hopes to use the loan to purchase a bale of t-shirts for resale. 

The profits will be used to purchase more clothing for the business. He hopes to live a happy life and to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of secondhand t-shirts.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Saturnina has a shop where she sells hypo or cleansing solutions by the liter. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw materials needed for making the hypo or cleansing solutions.

Saturnina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Saturnina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making hypo or cleansing solutions.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean, 33, is a married woman and the mother of three children, all of whom are single and living under her care. Her husband is Sodey 35, a local fisherman in his community. Mrs. Yean makes a living by selling fresh fish and vegetables in a very busy local market. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Mrs. Yean’s husband is concerned that his existing boat is broken now and he couldn’t use it to support him in fishing activity as before. That is why Mrs. Yean is applying for this loan to buy a new boat for her husband in fishing purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Kizota Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her early 30's, is married. She has two children who go to school. She has been running a business of selling fabrics, shoes and hand bags, from door to door for 5 years now. She works from 8 a.m to 12 a.m (works for four hrs. only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Janeth's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her inventory from just the fabrics to start selling shoes and hand bags. She also paid school fees and household expenses. Janeth has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics, bags and shoes to sell.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Kizota", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 27 years old. He is married and has one child, 2 years old. Philippe has been selling goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. for one year. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 8am until 7pm, every day except on Saturday. He currently employs one person to help him.

Philippe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand his business by purchasing more and various goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, biscuits, sugar, etc. for resale. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more livestock for sale

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino lives in Cagayan. He is married and blessed with three children. He is engaged in a farming business. He raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise to generate income and provide sustenance for his family. Each cropping season (April and November), Rufino earns approximately PHP 35,000 average net income. 

Rufino is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in his rice farming. He hopes this loan will grow his business operation.

In the future, Rufino would like to strengthen and diversify his business in order to provide productive living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 26 years old and supports two members of his family. He buys and sells second hand clothing and has been in the business for a period of two years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first term loan and hopes to use the money to purchase a bale of quality jean trousers and tshirts.  

The profits will be used to start a barber shop and purchase a lead battery charger for his business.He hopes to be self sustainable and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second hand clothing

loans.name: Norjana

texts.en:
Norjana is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Norjana has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Norjana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Norjana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Zacheus

texts.en:
Zacheus is 25 years old and married. They are blessed with two children, ages four and two. He is a tailor and has been in the business for a period of eight years earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.  

He has borrowed a loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the money to purchase sewing threads and materials for the business.  The anticipated profit will be used to improve business and also meet the welfare of his family.

His dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase sewing threads and materials

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Mrs. Duch, 52, is a married woman who now lives in the Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, she plants different kinds of crop on her own land.  Mrs. Duch always tries all her best to feed all the children to live in a proper life as the other villagers. Her husband is also a rice farmer. The couple earns about $6 per day from their business. They have given birth to six children in response. But now two of them are married and stay in separately house. Mrs. Duch and her husband would like to loan in amounts of $1,100 in order to purchase two cows for breeding.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Mariam has a tailoring shop that repairs and sews office and school uniforms. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed like cloth.
Mariam has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mariam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cloth

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her children. 

She owns motorcycles for transport as a source of income. She started this business three years ago and her major problem is failure of hired riders to remit money on time.

In spite of this, she still feels the business is worth doing and she desires to own at least ten motorcycles.

Janerose needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goods like soap, sugar and beans for resale at her retail shop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 48 years old, married and has six children. She has had a piggery business for six years and generates PHP 5,000 after selling two pigs every four months. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to make further improvements to her livestock shelter. She will also buy feed for the pigs. The purpose of maintaining and eventually growing the business is to meet the needs of her two children who are still in school. 

Erlinda's goal is to nurture her family abundantly in good values, both spiritual and financial.

loans.use: to improve her livestock shelter and buy pig feed.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 69-year-old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children up to university. 

He has operated a retail shop for 20 years now, and his main constraint is inadequate capital to invest in his shop. But his dream is to own a wholesale shop and also buy a motorcycle for transport business so as to increase on his daily income. He intends to get a hired driver to ride the motorcycle, who will remit to Edward 80% of the daily earning.

Edward needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: In order to live with a good standard of living such as others in her village, Lem works hard and struggles. She is a farmer. She stays alone which no children. To support her farming business, Lem wishes to borrow $150 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other related materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other related materials.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Salma has a shop that sells clothes, hair accessories and silver bracelets. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock like hair accessories & jewelry.
Salma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Salma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like hair, accessories and jewelry

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru:
Роза родилась и выросла в Казахстане. Ей 52 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. 
Роза родилась в простой семье. Она была старшим ребенком, у нее 5 братьев и  сестер, большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшими братьями и сестрами, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. Роза в детстве мечтала стать милиционером - защищать беззащитных и нести справедливость. После окончания школы Роза поступила в военное училище, затем подала документы на высшее образование. После окончания учебы, в советское время судьба отправляет Розу на службу в соседний Кыргызстан, там она познакомилась с будущим супругом. Таким образом, в 1988 году наша героиня выходит замуж, а уже через год у молодожен родилась дочь. Так как оба супруга были военными, жизнь их кидает с места на место, на съемные  квартиры. Пока супруги служили отечеству,  шли годы и семья уже состояла из 5 человек. «Мы не успели оглянуться, а уже по выслуге лет и на пенсию оказывается пора» - говорит Роза. Супруги на протяжении 15 лет откладывали деньги на жилье, и вот в 2008 году они купили дом в центре города Карабалта, на оставшиеся 10 000 сом Роза решила закупить немного товара и попробовать перепродать, первая партия которого ушла хорошо. Роза поняла, что она сможет работать в сфере торговли и выходит продавать на рынок. За три года, Роза увеличила оборот до 60 000 сом, и смогла оплатить учебу в ВУЗе своей старшей дочери.
Для дальнейшего увеличения товарооборта и расширения ассортимента товаров, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от этой деятельности она планирует вложить в открытие дополнительной точки торговли. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Rose was born and raised in Kazakhstan. She is 52 years old and married with 3 children. 

Rosa was born into an ordinary family. She was the eldest child; she had five brothers and sisters.  Most of her time was devoted to household chores: looking after younger brothers and sisters, housework, and farm work.  As a child, Rosa dreamed of becoming a police officer to protect the innocent and bring justice. After high school, Rose went to military school, then filed documents to apply for a higher education. After graduation, in Soviet times, fate sent Rosa to serve in neighboring Kyrgyzstan, where she met her future husband. Thus, in 1988, our heroine got married, and a year later the newlywed had a daughter. Since both husband and wife were in the military, life threw them from place to place in rented apartments. 

While her husband served his country, the years passed and the family grew to five people. "We have not had time to look around, and it's time to retire,"  said Rosa. The couple had been saving for a house for fifteen years, and in 2008 they bought a house in the city center of Karabalta.  With the 10,000 som  they had left, Rosa decided to buy some products and try to resell them.  The first batch went well. Rosa realized that she was able to work in trade and selling in the market. For three years, Rosa has increased her turnover to 60,000 som and was able to pay for tuition at the university for her eldest daughter. To further increase sales and expand the variety of goods she sells, Rose turned to the company Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She wants to use proceeds from this money to open more shops. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she offers

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Rosalyn has a shop that sells fish such as sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Rosalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 58 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Denia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Denia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and to pay for labor.

Denia has been in this business for 20 years. Denia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and to pay for labor

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years of age, married and blessed with four children. 

She has managed a hog-raising business for 10 years now. She usually earns PHP 8,000 from selling pigs every four months when they reach full growth. She uses her income to maintain the immediate needs and studies of her children. 

Grace is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase piglets to raise and feed so that she can earn a higher income and save for unexpected emergencies. 

She dreams of fully providing for her children's needs in school as they complete their education, which will be serving as the key to a bright future for them.

loans.use: to purchase piglets feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children. 

Brenda has a shop that sells frozen foods, like hotdogs & sausage. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 59 years old and married. She has 6 children. With 1 child still in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for her children.

Concepcion runs a sari sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

Concepcion has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, curls, bread, egg, etc.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment. Jessica has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a widowed woman. She has 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dulce is 54 years old and her children are in school.

Dulce has a business of buying & selling vegetables in the Philippines. Dulce has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

Dulce has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Divina has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Divina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Divina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Ping

texts.en: Mrs. Ping, 32, has been in farming business for over five years ago. She has been living in the Siem Reap Province. She is married woman without a kid even though she has married for a few years. She and her husband always help each other to improve their standard of living. Mrs. Ping is concerned that she faces difficulties in travelling top anywhere. She and her husband always paid for motor taxi when they need to go out their house. To solve the problem, Mrs. Ping has requested a loan to be used to buy a new motorcycle for traveling need in the whole family. With the remainder cash, she will use to enlarge her crop-planting business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married and has 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelly is 66 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Nelly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Nelly has been in this business for 22 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Anastacia has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Anastacia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anastacia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Jane has a shop that sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.
Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en: Mrs. Roun is a 34 year-old married who make a living by selling some Khmer cakes and other front of her home, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Roun is blessed with three children, all of them are students and living under her care. She has a life partner in her husband who is a coal seller in the village as well. They are able to make an income from the different occupations in average of $4.25USD. Mrs. Roun will use all percentages of a loan fund to add with her personal saving to construct a new house for her and her family’s members to live in as her currently is very old and broken.

loans.use: to construct a new house .

loans.name: Nzega Group

texts.en:
Asma, who is in her early 30s is married with two children who go to school.  She's been running a charcoal business for two years now. She works from 7 a.m to 8p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal, helped with household expenses and she's paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Nzega" which is comprised of a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Rubie has a shop that sells longganisa (spiced meat similar to chorizo) & home-made sausage. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making sausage.

Rubie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rubie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making sausage.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a 39-year-old humble villager who has been living in Siem Reap Province for a long time ago. She and her husband have given birth to two school-aged kids. 

Mrs. Sam and her husband are working in the same field at construction sector. Mr. Sam’s husband is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. Mrs. Sam and husband have been paying money for taxis to get to work because they don't own a vehicle. To solve this trouble, Mrs. Sam and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which will allow them to commute to their work location.

In future plan, Mrs. Sam will buy housing materials for rebuild her old house and to support her children to finish high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru:
Кундуз 26 лет, замужем, воспитывает сына и дочь. Кундуз поступила медицинское училище по специальности фармацевт и после окончания учебы, начала работать в аптеке. Видя подрастающего сына и дочь, Кундуз решила найти пути обеспечения достойного будущего для них. Получив опыт в сфере торговли,  в 2008 году она решает открыть свой собственный аптечный бизнес. Кундуз берет в аренду помещение внутри Баткенской областной больницы и  заключает контракт с местными поставщиками и производителями на реализацию медицинских препаратов. В связи с тем, что аптека находится внутри больницы, график работы аптеки -  круглосуточный. Для того, чтобы обеспечить такой режим, ей помогает супруг Тургунбай, вдвоем работают посменно. 
	 С каждым годом товарный запас увеличивается, Кундуз своей коммуникабельностью и индивидуальным подходом к каждому посетителю смогла приобрести постоянных клиентов и добиться роста в бизнесе. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  30,000 сом (KGS). Кредит будет использован для увеличения ассортимента. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Kunduz is 26 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter. Kunduz graduated from pharmacy school and began working at a pharmacy. When she had her son and daughter, she decided find ways to ensure a decent future for them. Since she had experience in trade, in 2008 she decided to open her own pharmacy business. Kunduz leases a shop in Batken Regional Hospital and contracts with local suppliers and producers for medication. Due to the fact that her pharmacy is located within the hospital, the work is non-stop. In order to cover the hours her husband, Turgunbai, helps her, and they work in shifts. 

Each year their inventory increases, and Kunduz's communication skills and customer service brings regular customers and helps the business grow.  To  further develop her business, Kunduz contacted Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). The loan will be used to increase the variety of goods she offers.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she offers.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean  est commerçant, né au Rwanda.et il est le client d’ACB depuis 2009. Il est marié, il  a  38 ans, il a 5 enfants entre 5 ans et 13 ans, et tous vont à l’école, Il  a 2 ans des études secondaire. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 40 cartons d’eau minéral, 20 cartons des savons, 25 cartons des biscuits, 20 cartons de jus de pommes. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’améliorer  la qualité des services pour attire la clientèle, et accroitre la capacité de son business pour  la satisfaction de son clients   . Pour ses ambitions il voudrait construire sa propre maison et devenir un grand commerçant dans la région, et assure l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. He has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is married and 38 years old, and he has five children, aged 5 to 13, all of whom go to school. He has two years of secondary education. 

This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 40 boxes of water, 20 boxes of soaps, 25 boxes of cookies, and 20 boxes of apple juice. No problems at all are expected in repaying his loan. 

His strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service for attracting customers and to grow his business capacity for satisfying his customers. As for his ambitions, Jean would like to build his own house, to become a major merchant, and to ensure his children are educated.

loans.use: to buy 40 boxes of water, 20 boxes of soaps, 25 boxes of cookies, and 20 boxes of apple juice

loans.name: Moth

texts.en: Mrs. Moth, age 38, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that she buys from local fishermen. She currently earns an average of US$3 a day, and she has been running her business for over five years. Her husband is a trailer driver in and around Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Moth is the mother of four teenage children, who are no longer in school. One of children is working as a waitress, and she each contribute some of her incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. Mrs. Moth is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Moth is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell and to purchase a motor for picking up her fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell and to purchase a motor for picking up her fish.

loans.name: Tran's Group

texts.en:
H. was born in 1959. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, Duc Tu commune. She has 4 children, two of whom have a job. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a store. Her main job is farming. Her family has a monthly income of about 10,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). 

H. has participated in SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 1,526,000 VND and has repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more goods to sell. She is the group leader of this 6 member group loan.

About other borrowers in her group:
H. is 27 years old. She has a child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to support her small business.
N. is 27 years old. She has a child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
H. is 45 years old. She has 4 children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to repair her shop.
H. is 29 years. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy chickens.
H. is 28 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Jane Njuguini

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married to a businessman. They have two children, 17 and 9 years old. 

She runs a clothing sales business at Kayole in Nairobi. She has been in this business for five years now, and she says her major challenge is delayed payments by debtors.

She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy clothes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business to a big boutique and open a tailoring training college. 

She sees herself improving her family's living standards and, in the future, building a residential house. She describes herself as humble, patient and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Pe

texts.en: Mr. Phat is a coco seller for bulk and retail in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is a 31 year old married man. He has three single children who still study and depending on his income. Mr. Phat earns a profit about $4USD per day from his business. His wife is a meat seller in her community and is getting an income about $3USD per day. To increase additional incomes, Mr. Phat concerned that he need some money as a working capital to run a small business by selling a various of products such plastic products, and soft drinks for selling. And with the rest, he also uses to buy a new trailer motorbike for picking up her coco for his regular clients.

loans.use: to run a small business, mix-producing business, and buy a new trailer motorbike.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru:
Гульзат 38 лет. Совместно с супругом Намазбеком растят троих детей. В 2004 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле мясом, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS).  Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Гульзат имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 6,000-7,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли начать постройку большого дома для своей семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гульзат обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 30 голов овец и коз.  Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в завершение стройки и накопить деньги на обучение в университете для своих детей. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 38 years old. She and her husband, Namazbekom, are raising three children. In 2004, the couple started a business in the meat trade, using 10,000 soms (KGS) as seed capital. Because she was able to develop her business and find regular customers, Gulzat now has average income of 6,000-7,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to the hard work they put into their business, the couple were able to begin construction on a large house for the family.

In order to further improve and expand her business, Gulzat turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy thirty head of sheep and goats. With income from the loan, Gulzat plans to complete construction on her house and save money for university tuition for her children.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn works as a massager staff in one hotel in Siem Reap Province. She always gets a salary in monthly. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income around $5USD each day to share some responsibility with Mrs. Oeurn in daily expenses.  The couple blessed with two children who are young and still studying in local school. Mrs. Oeurn will use a loan in amount of $1,200 in order to change a new motorbike for her husband as his existing motorbike is getting old and buying a new boat for fishing activity.

loans.use: to change a new motorbike and to purchase a new boat for fishing activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et liqueurs au marché de HEDZRANAWOE depuis 2009, Ama est mère de 02 enfants. Elle est à son premier cycle de crédit à WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des boissons et pagnes afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Son mari est électronicien.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and liqueurs at the Hedzranawoe market since 2009, Ama is the mother of two children. she is on her first loan cycle with WAGES and is seeking this loan to buy beverages and pagnes in order to respond to her customers' requests. Her husband is an electronics engineer.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and liqueurs.

loans.name: Keub

texts.en: Mrs. Keub, age 54, is married to Thorn, age 45. She has eleven children, ten of whom are single and one is married and living in dependently. Three of whom are employed in different jobs. For the rest attends school. They always use their own farmland to grow some crop for both rainy season and dry season. Mrs. Keub and her husband can make an income of approximately $4USD each day to help cover the family’s expense. Mrs. Keub will be using a loan in a mount of $500 to buy fertilizes and seeds for planting during rainy season coming now.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizes and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois, au marché de HEDZRANAWOE, Abra a 57ans. Mariée à un employé à l’Université de Lomé, elle sollicite ce  deuxième montant pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois à KANTE et ANIE.   Elle est maman de 03 enfants et  a commencé en 1990.
texts.en: A retailer of charcoal at the Hédzranawoé market, Abra is 57 years old. Married to an employee of the University of Lomé, she is seeking her second loan to buy bags of charcoal in Kanté and Anie. She is the mother of three children and started this business in 1990.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret Wanjiru

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, single and has one child who is eighteen years old. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now and she says her major challenge is financial constraints. Margaret is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy shoes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. She sees herself improving her family's living standards and giving her son a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: Shoes

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохир проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Живет вместе с родителями. Он имеет среднее образование. Уже пять лет как он занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке "Саховат", где продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки масла, окорочков и закупа еще одного холодильника.
texts.en: Tohir lives in Kulob. He is 26 years old. He is married. He lives with his parents. He has a high school education. He has been working in trade for five years. He rents a grocery shop in the Sahovat market. He is taking out a loan to buy oil, chicken legs, and another refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy oil, chicken legs, and another refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motto-bike for transporting the vegetables on time.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Revendeur  de lits, de meubles et divers, Kodjo est âgé de 51ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et à sept enfants.
Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et se bat du meilleur qu’il peut pour assurer une  bonne éducation à  ses enfants.
 Il s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend au marché noir d’Akodessewa.il est à son premier crédit dans notre institution.
texts.en:
Kodjo sells beds and various types of furniture.  He is 51 years old.  He is married to a saleswoman and has seven children.  
He started this business in 2001 and has done the best he can to provide a good education for his children. 
He gets his supplies in Lomé and resells them on the black market in Akodessewa. He is on his first loan with our institution.

Revendeur  de lits, de meubles et divers, Kodjo est âgé de 51ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et à sept enfants.
Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et se bat du meilleur qu’il peut pour assurer une  bonne éducation à  ses enfants.
 Il s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend au marché noir d’Akodessewa.il est à son premier crédit dans notre institution.

loans.use: to buy furniture and beds for resale.

loans.name: Nhock

texts.en: Mrs. Nhock is 47 years old lives in Siem Reap province.  She is married but without children.  She and her husband work hard together to support their daily needs.  They work together as farmers; rice is their primary crop.  Currently, they struggle to grow enough to support themselves as the plowing machine that they use to turn under their rice paddy is old and broken down and they lack money for fertilizer.  Mrs. Nhock would like to request a loan from Kiva to repair her plowing machine and purchase seeds and fertilizer.   Currently, they make around $3 per day, but she is hopeful that with a loan, they will be able to increase their income and provide better for daily needs.

loans.use: to repair her old plow and buy seeds, fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Handkerchiefs, caps, belts, wallets, toys etc

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi  est âgée de 44ans. Elle est mariée à un menuisier. Elle a quatre  enfants.

Elle travaille comme revendeuse de maïs et d’huile de coco depuis 1991.Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend  au marché d’Akodessewa.
Elle est à son deuxième crédit  et souhaite à nouveau un crédit pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 44 years old.   She is married to a carpenter.  She has four children.
She has been selling corn and coconut oil since 1991.  She gets her supplies in Lomé at the market in Akodessewa.  
She is on her second loan and is hoping to get this money to restock her supplies.

loans.use: to buy corn and coconut oil.

loans.name: Penina

texts.fr: Penina est commerçante, né au Rwanda.et elle est mariée, elle a  30 ans, elle a 1 enfant de 3 ans, elle a six ans des études secondaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour renforcer son business de l’alimentation. Elle  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est  améliore la qualité de service qu’elle donnée et acheter des articles de qualité pour attire la clientèle. Pour ses ambitions elle voudrait ouvrir des autres alimentations dans les différentes régions, construire des  maisons pour sa famille et  payer le minerval de ses enfants et  les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Penina is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. She is married and 30 years old, and she has a 3-year-old child. She has six years of secondary education. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. Penina is going to use her loan for bolstering her grocery business. No difficulties at all are expected in repaying her loan. 

Her strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service she provides and to buy quality goods to attract customers. As for her ambitions, Penina would like to open more grocery stores in different regions, to build houses for her family, to cover the school fees for her children, and to take care of them.

loans.use: to bolster her grocery business

loans.name: Hafizakhon

texts.ru: Хафизахон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Хафизахон не имеет высшего образования. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Hafizahon lives in the Rudaki district. She is 35 years old. She is married. She has five children. Hafizahon does not have a higher education. She works at home sewing traditional clothes. She has been doing this for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: To against with the chance and living in good living standard as others, so lots of couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to develop economy in family. In the many choices of works, Mrs. Kong and her husband always negotiation with each other for finding solution to progress more revenues in family. Currently, Mrs. Kong is a farmer. Take time from doing farming business, she words as a fish seller around the market and village. She could be made approximately $3 per day. Talk to her husband is a local factory worker in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia.Mrs.Kong wishes to loan in amount of $400 in order to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  localidade de Chamissava, distrito municipal da Catembe a sul de Mocambique no ano de 1971. Cresceu  e fez o seu ensino primário na antiga Escola Missao, porque a familia nao tinha condicoes para continuar a sustentar os seus estudos.
 Casou se e tem 4 filhos  em idade escolar. E, devido a sitiacao economica que nao era satisfatória para a familia, comecou com os negócios muito cedo e vendia diversos produtos.
Atraves das amigas teve uma pequena formação na area da avicultura, e dai comecou com a criação de frangos, actividade que vem desenvolvendo  ha mais de 4 anos numa capoeira de material precario.
Tem larga experiencia nesta actividade, mas o unico problema é que na calada da noite varios animais tem invadido a capoeira e comem os pintos assim como os frangos e isto tem criado perdas.
Debateu com o marido e decidiram procurar a hluvuku para solicitarem credito no valor de 15.000,00mt para compra de material de construcao  ( cimento blocos e outros ) como forma de minimizar riscos de invasao de animais na capoeira.
Tem como plano futuro fazer  crescer cada vez mais no negocio.
texts.en:
Helena was born in 1971 in Chamissava, which is in the Catembe municipal district in southern Mozambique.She grew up and attended primary school at the old Mission School because her family could not afford to continue paying for her studies.

She got married and has four school-age children. And because her family's economic situation was not satisfactory, she began in business very early and sold a variety of products.

Through friends, she has a little training in aviculture, and she began raising chickens. She has been raising them for more than four years in a poorly built chicken coop.

She has a lot of experience with this activity, but the only problem is that in the dead of night several animals have invaded the coop and eaten the chicks and chickens, so Helena has had losses. She discussed it with her husband, and they decided to ask Hluvuku for a loan of 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement blocks, etc.) as a way to minimize the risk of animals invading the coop.

In the future Helena plans to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru:
Уулкан – 46-летняя фермерша, живущая в селе Боз – Караган. Замужем, вырастила семерых детей, младшей их которых 17 лет.  Уулкан традиционно занимается животноводством, так как семья в  фермерстве уже несколько поколений. На данный момент в хозяйстве Уулкан – 2 коровы, 15 баранов и 3 лошади.  В летний период такое хозяйство позволяет Уулкан получать прибыль в сумме  приблизительно 18,000 сом (KGS)от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она намерена закупить 12 телят и отправить скот на летний выпас в горную местность.  В будущем, Уулкан планирует развивать  и расширять свой бизнес. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Uulkan is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Boz - Karagan. She is married and has raised seven children, the youngest of whom is 17 years old. Uulkan's work in animal husbandry is a tradition, since her family has been farming for several generations. Now on her small farm, Uulkan has two cows, fifteen sheep and three horses. In summer, Uulkan makes about 18,000 Som (KGS) from selling meat and dairy products. 

In order to further expand her business, Uulkan contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS). With the money, she intends to purchase twelve calves and cattle to send to summer grazing in the highlands. In the future, Uulkan plans to develop and expand her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provínca de Maputo no distrito de Matuituine a 37 anos. Fez o seu ensino primário na sua terra natal, mudou se para uma outra localidade apenas com 7 anos com seus pais que procuravam melhores condicoes de vida.
Parou muito cedo de estudar apenas com nivel primario uma vez que a exigencia antigamente é que as mulheres deviam aprender a ser dona de casa para logo que se casassem nao criar deabonos para a nova familia que iria pertencer , dai casou oficialmente donde veio ater 4 filhos com seu marido que era padeiro de profissao.
Devido a guerra mudaram se para catembe, para se abrigarem da guerra que se fazia sentir muito na zona sul e houve a necessidade dela trabalhar para ajudar o marido devido a familia que ja era enorme.
Com seus fundos proprios conseguiu abrir a sua pequena loja  localizada no ponte cais da catembe e atraves de amigas incentivaram lhe a pedir credito para aumentar o seu negocio tendo ja se benefeciado de 4 creditos na hluvuku.
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade (10cxas de refresco,10 de cerveja nacional  e 20 cxas de cerveja)
 Planos para o futuro,ampliar o seu negocio,abrindo mais estabelecimento iisto é crescer no seu negocio e para tal vai precisar de mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in Maputo Province, Matuituine District 37 years ago. She attended primary school in her hometown, and when she was only seven years old she moved to another town with her parents, who were searching for better living conditions.

She quit studying very early, when she had barely finished primary school, because the requirement used to be that women should learn to be housewives so that later when they married, they would not discredit the new family they would belong to. She then got married officially and had four children with her husband, who was a baker.

Because of the war they moved to Catembe. They were seeking shelter from the war, which affected a lot of the southern area, and Lidia needed to work in order to help her husband, because their family was huge. She was able to open a small store on Catembe's pier with her own money, and friends urged her to ask for a loan to expand her business. She has now benefited from four Hluvuku loans.

With the current loan, she intends to buy basic items (10 cases of soft drinks, 10 of domestic beer and 20 cases of beer).

Plans for the future include expanding her business by opening another store. This will help her business grow, and to do it she will need more loans.

loans.use: to buy products (beer, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr:
Ayaovi est âgée  de 30 ans .Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
 
Ayaovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009.elle revend de la friperie vers Bé et s’approvisionne au marché de Hedzranawoé.
 Elle  a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter de la friperie.
texts.en:
Ayaovi is 30 years old.  She is married to a businessman.  She doesn’t have any children in her care. 
Ayaovi has been working as a saleswoman since 2009.   She sells second-hand clothing in Bé and gets her supplies at the market in Hedzranawoé. 
She has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to stock up on second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Abagonarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Suavis est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes et haricot depuis 8ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Gérard ; un cultivateur et ont ensemble 4 enfants dont 1 étudie. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes et haricot à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« ABAGONARIMWE».
texts.en:
Suavis is a 29-year-old merchant who lives in the middle of the country in the city of Gitega. She has been doing commerce in bananas and beans for eight years. She is also a farmer and has a fifth grade education. She is married to Gérard, a farmer, and they have four children, of whom one is in school. 

The Kiva loan that Suavis is getting will enable her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas and beans for resale in order to make large profits.  

She is a member of the community group “ABAGONARIMWE”.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas and beans for resale in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg, age 42, is a seamstress who lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar-the capital city of Mongolia. She makes  work wear and suits and sells them at the bazaar everyday. Gantsetseg has had her own business since 1998. Sometimes she needs to hire a sewer part-time to help  her in her business. Sometimes she has urgent orders and needs the capital to buy cloth and other supplies. So  she is taking a loan which amounts to MNT 1.000.000 to purchase some clothing  materials to increase her business production.

loans.use: To purchase some clothing materials to raise business production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy one bundle of children's clothes, three dozen of chains with pendants and one dish of dried okra.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилжон проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Одилжон имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии он не работает. На сегодняшний день он занимается производством пельменей. Арендует помещение, где открыл свой маленький цех. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения нового оборудования. Он хочет заменить устаревшее оборудование.
texts.en: Odiljon lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 42 years old. He is married. He has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Odiljon has a higher education in economics. He does not work in his profession. He produces pelmeni (meat-filled boiled dumplings similar to ravioli). He rents a place where he opened his small shop. He has been doing this work for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy new equipment. He wants to replace obsolete equipment.

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Grace Muthoni

texts.en: Grace is 36 years old, married and has two children ages ten and seven years old. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. Grace has been in this business for ten years  and she says her major challenge is financial constraints. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy shoes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. Grace sees herself opening a shoes sales shop in the central business district of Nairobi. She also hopes to buy a plot of land. She describes herself as aggressive and honest.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
nasceu em Tete no centro de Mocambique no ano de 1972. Cresceu  e fez o seu encino primario na vila onde nasceu.  Juntou se maritalmente e émae de uma filha.
Poque o salario do marido nao cobria com as despesas da casa teve que muito cedo comecar a trabalhar para o sustento da sua familia e dai nunca mais voltou á escola.
Em busca de melhores condicoes transferiram se para maputo onde esteve a trabalhar por muito tempo como caixa numa ferragem que depois faliu e fechou as portas. Teve que comecar com seus fundos proprios um negocio que podesse alimentar a ela assim como a sua filha menor.
Agora ela é dona duma  de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos alimentares. Na sua convivencia com vizuinhos ouviu falar da hluvuku onde aproximou e benefeciou se de 4 créditos que os mesmos foram para ampliacao do seu negocio e diversificacao dos produtos.sendo este o seu primeiro emprestimo no espera que com o credito que sera concedido podera comprar produtos tais como refersco,cerveja acucar bolachas e sacos de meixas.
Com o credito de 10.000,00mt pretende cpmprar produtos de primeira necessidade. 
 Projectos pessoais para o futuro é expandir o seu negocio isto é abrindo um bar para a comercializacao de bebeidas mas para tal precisara de outros créditos. Para terminar agradecer  apoio dado pela hluvuku- kiva.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in 1972 in Tete, which is in central Mozambique. She grew up and went to elementary school in the town where she was born. She got married and has a daughter. Because her husband's salary did not cover the household expenses, she had to begin working very early to support her family, and so she never returned to school. 

Searching for better living conditions, they moved to Maputo, where she worked for a long time as a cashier at a hardware store that later went bankrupt and closed its doors. She had to begin a business with her own money so she could feed herself and her little daughter. Now she is the owner of a small store where she sells groceries. Through her friends, Isabel heard about Hluvuku, which she approached, and she has benefited from four loans. They were for expanding her store, and the first loan was for diversifying her products. With the loan she will receive now, she will be able to buy products like soft drinks, beer, sugar, crackers and sacks of plums. With this 10,000 loan, she will buy basic items.

Isabel's personal projects for the future are to expand this store and open a bar so she can sell drinks, but to do this she will need more loans. Finally, she is grateful for the support Hluvuku and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy and sell products.

loans.name: Vaysidin

texts.ru: Вайсидин проживает в районе Сарбанд. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Вайсидин занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом у него имеется продуктовый магазин. В торговле ему помогает его сын. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы запастись. Так как накануне великого месяца Рамазан спрос на его товар увеличиться.
texts.en: Vaysidin lives in ​​Sarband. He is 30 years old, married, and he has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Vaysidin works in trade. Near his house he has a grocery store. His son helps him. He is taking out a loan to buy food to stock up because on the eve of the great month of Ramadan demand for his products increases.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Prossy has a music studio, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sound speakers for music. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Prossy hopes to expand her business. Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase sound speakers for music.

loans.name: Afi Awefan

texts.fr:
Afi est âgée de 27ans. Elle est mariée à un ingénieur de génie civil  et a un enfant.

Elle est revendeuse de mèches et de cartes de recharges  depuis 2009 à Lomé

Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Lomé et au siège de Togo cellulaire  pour  les cartes  de recharge.
texts.en: Afi is 27 years old. She is married to a civil engineer and is the mother of one child. She has been selling hair extensions and recharge phonecards in Lomé since 2009. She gets her supply of hair extensions at the great market in Lomé and her supply of phonecards at the head office of the phone company "Togo Cellulaire".

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and recharge phonecards.

loans.name: Bakir

texts.ru:
Bakir jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. Bakir 45 let. 
On uje 11 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki yego taxi. On ochen dobrosovestniy i trudolubiviy chelovek.
texts.en:
Bakir is married and has four children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and beloved children.  Bakir is 45 years old. 
 
He has been driving a taxi for eleven years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his taxi.  He is a very honest and hard-working man.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Mamadrasul

texts.ru: Мамадрасул проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сыновья находятся в России. Сам он имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он более 8 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует помещение, где открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для покупки конфет, сахара, муки, сливочного масла и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Mamadrasul lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 53 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife, and his sons are in Russia. He has a degree in teaching. He has been trading in the market for more than eight years.  He rents a spot where he opened a grocery store. He is taking out a loan to buy candy, sugar, flour, butter and sausage.

loans.use: to buy candy, sugar, flour, butter and sausage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials compra de materials (beams, cement and zinc sheets).

loans.name: Elie Yawo

texts.fr:
Elie est un jeune célibataire et sans enfant de 27 ans.

Il est ingénieur de son et pianiste depuis 2010.Pour mieux exercer son travail il sollicite un premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour s’acheter une table de mixage.
 
Il s’approvisionne  dans une boutique de la place (l’établissement Gracelec) et exerce son métier à Anfamé.
texts.en:
Elie is a young 27-year-old man. He is single and has no children. 

He has been working as a sound engineer and pianist since 2010. He gets his supplies in a local shop (Gracelec) and practices his profession in Anfamé.

In order to improve his work performance, he is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase a mixing console.

loans.use: to buy a mixing console

loans.name: Bento

texts.pt:
Nasceu em xai-xai, distrito de xai-xai,provincia de gaza, tem 30 anos, masculino, tem nivel medio de escolarização, solteiro vive maritalmente tem residencia fixa na cidade de maputo onde se encontra a familia , tem 3 filhos, 2 raparigas e 1 rapaz,a  de  7 anos encontra se a estudar,os outros tem 4anos e 2anos . nao tem outras pessoas a sua responsabilidade .
  Reside  em bela- vista onde se encontra a trabalhar na administracao do distrito de matutuine,é  tecnico profissional de administracao publica na area de recursos humanos, tem salario de  7.470,00mt, com salario sustenta a familia e faz poupança.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutro banco, conheceu a hluvuku agora que esta aqui no distrito este é o primeiro emprestimo de  5.000,00mt para vedação do terreno no sector de habitação. tem sonho de construir um centro social para os funcionarios da administracao e o desafio sera falta de bens de garantia que possam cubrir o montante que vai solicitar porque o projecto sera de grande dimensão.
texts.en:
Bento was born in Xai-Xai, in the Xai-Xai district, Gaza province.  He is 30 years old and has some post secondary school education.  He is unmarried but lives with his partner in the city of Maputo with their family.  He has 3 children, 2 girls and a boy.  The eldest is 7 and attends school.  The other children are ages 4 and 2. He does not support anyone else.

He lives in Bela-Vista where he works in the local goverment of the district of Matutuine.  He is a technical professional of public administration working in Human Resources.  He earns a salary of 7.470,00mt per month and is able to support his family and save money.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He learned about Hluvuku once he came to this district.  This is his first loan, in the amount of 5.000,00mt to be used to fence the property around his home.  His dream is to build a community center for people who work in the local government.  The challenge will be the lack of property to use as collateral for the amount of money he would request because it would be a large-scale project.

loans.use: to fence the land around his home.

loans.name: Shirukubute Group

texts.fr:
Beatrice est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique comme les savons,dentifrices,produits de beaute pour femmes,les souliers pour enfants depuis 3ans. Elle était couturière avant de commencer ce métier. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 9e année au niveau de l’école secondaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 1 enfant de 2 ans. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique(savons,dentifrices,produits de beaute,souliers pour enfants...) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« SHIRUKUBUTE».
texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30 year-old merchant who lives in the central area of the country, in the city of Gitega. She has been trading in various shop articles such as soap, toothpaste, beauty products for women, and childrens' shoes for the past three years. She was a seamstress before she started in this business. She went to school for nine year, up to middle school. She is married and has one child, who is two years old.
The Kiva loan of 2000,000 Burundian francs that she is granted will allow her to increase her capital in order to purchase large quantities of shop items to retail, so she can make substantial profits.
She is a member of community group “Shirukubute.”

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of soap, toothpaste, beauty products, childrens shoes, etc for resale in her store

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Matutuine, Provincia de Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, solteiro, masculino vive  maritalmente tem 2 filhas 1 tem 7 anos  frequenta a  segunda classe e a outra tem 3anos de idade.Estão a sua responsabilidade a avó paterna, sua mãe e 2 irmãs mais novas tem residencia em Ka tembe N’sime onde se encontra outra parte da familia.
Neste encontra se a trabalhar na Sede Distrital do Partido Frelimo Matutuine, como Tecnico de organização mobilização  e propaganda, tem salario de 8.300,00mt, com o ganha compra alimentos, paga despesas escolares  pra familia e poupa algum valor.
Nunca teve emprestimos com outros bancos, o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku foi de 8.000,00mt-fabrico de blocos o segundo de 12.000,00mt-compra de material de contrução o terceiro tambem compra de material de contrução local para herguer uma casinha em material precario em Bela-Vista o quarto foi pra compra de cama. O actual emprestimo é de 22.000,00mt para compra de material de construção.
No futuro ele pensa em fazer fomento pecuario na compra de gado bovino para criar, e vai recorer a Hluvuku pra o financiamento.
texts.en:
Augusto was born in Matutuine, Maputo province.  He is 28 years old, unmarried but living with his partner with whom he has 2 daughters.  One is 7 years old and attends school.  The other is 3.  He also supports his paternal grandfather, his mother, and two younger sisters who live in Katembe N'sime, where the rest of his family lives. 

He works in the district headquarters of the Frelimo Matutuine Party, as a public organizing and propaganda professional.  He earns 8.300.00mt which he uses to purchase food, pay for school expenses, for his family, and savings.

He has never had a loan with other banks.  His first loan with Hluvuku was for 8.000,00mt to make cement blocks.  The second was for 12.000,00mt to purchase construction materials.  The third was also to purchase construction materials to build a house of low quality materials in Bela-Vista.  The fourth was for the purchase of a bed.  This loan is for 22.000,00mt and will be used to purchase construction materials.  In the future, Augusto would like to start a cattle business, purchasing and raising cattle.  He will work with Hluvuku for the financing.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement block).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase better tires and other spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Kangnigan

texts.fr:
Kangnigan  est âgée de 34ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il est papa de trois(03) enfants.

 Il est revendeur de glaçons et de pure water depuis 2009.Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend à kangnikopé un quartier de la ville.

Il sollicite ce premier crédit à Wages afin d’acheter un nouveau congélateur. Il emploie une personne qui l’aide dans son commerce pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kangnigan is 34 years old. He is married to a saleswoman. He is the dad of three children.

He has been retailing ice and purified water since 2009. He gets his supplies from Lome and resells in Kangnikopé, one of the city's districts.

He is requesting this first loan from Wages to purchase a new freezer. He employs one person who helps him in his trade to better satisfy his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Niyamaddin

texts.ru: Niyamaddin jivet v Absheron regione. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Niyamaddin 28 let. On etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyego otca. Uje 5 let kak on zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin(tak je menyayet maslo tormazov, mashinnoye maslo, maslo matora i t.d)Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti i maslo dlya pochinki mashin i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Niyamaddin lives in the Absheron region. He is single and has no children. Niyamaddin is 28 years old. He started this business with his father.  He has been working as a car mechanic for five years.  He also changes motor oil, break fluid, engine fluid, etc.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts and oil to repair cars and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy parts and oil to repair cars

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is still single and does not have children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for 10 years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future open a shop in the Central Business District. He describes himself as honest, sincere and focused.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ladies trousers to sell

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 20 years old. She lives in Ijevan city with her parents and her school-aged brother. Nelli has been running her own hairdressing salon for about two years. Before this business, Nelli was engaged in food sales, but in 2009 she changed her business and she hasn't regretted this change. 

With the help of her first Kiva loan, Nelli was able to develop her hairdressing salon and now she has a lot of regular clients. Now her business is going very well and thanks to profit from her business, she and her parents decided to open also a small butcher shop. They have already bought a refrigerator and meat chopper and they hope to start their new business very soon. Nelli transferred her hairdressing salon to her home, where she assigned a room for it. So Nelli and her parents set up their new butcher shop in the place of hairdressing salon. Nelli is seeking a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy a shop-window refrigerator for her new butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy a shop-window refrigerator for her new butcher shop

loans.name: Twunguruzanye Group

texts.fr:
Gérard est un commerçant âgé de 37ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de haricots depuis 6ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de haricots à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWUNGURUZANYE»
texts.en:
Gérard is a 37 years old merchant who lives in the central area of the country, in the city of Gitega. He has been in the beans retail business for six years. He also is a grower. He went to school up to the primary level. He is married and a father of four children, two of whom are attending primary school.
The 90,000 Burundian francs loan from Kiva he is being granted allows him to increase his capital to purchase large quantities of beans to retail in order to make substantial profits.
He is a member of community group "Twunguruzanye."

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy large quantities of beans to retail in order to make substantial profits

loans.name: Steven Muiruri

texts.en: Steven is a married man and they have one child aged four years old whom they wish to give a quality education to the university level. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for two years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes and shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, put up his own business premise where he will not be paying rent. He describes himself as aggressive, clever and humble.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Tilek

texts.ru:
Тилек – энергичный мастер – сварщик, изготовляющий железные ворота  и решетки.  Он начал этот бизнес в 1999 году, закупив материалы на стартовый капитал в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Работы Тилека стали популярны и его бизнес успешно развивается.  Увлечение  Тилека своей работой сподвигнули его младшего брата к освоению профессии сварщика, превратив его в  надежного помощника. Упорно работая и выпуская качественные металлические изделия, которые обеспечивают ежемесячный доход в сумме 6,500 сом (KGS),  братья смогли обрести круг постоянных клиентов  и заказчиков. 
Для увеличения ассортимента своих изделий, Тилек обратился в компанию « Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)на покупку материала – листов железа.  Доходы от кредита, Тилек планирует направить на постройку дома  и в следующем году – жениться. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Tilek is an energetic master welder who makes iron gates and grills. He started this business in 1999.  He bought the materials he needed to start with  25,000 Som (KGS). Tilek's work became popular and his business is developing successfully. Tilek's passion for his work motivated his younger brother to become a professional welder, making him a reliable assistant. Working hard and producing quality metal products, the brothers were able to find a circle of regular clients and customers, which provide a monthly income of 6,500 som (KGS), .
