To increase the range of his products, Tilek has asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy iron sheets. With the income from this loan, Tilek plans to build a house and, next year, get married. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is single and has no children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for five years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy trousers to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, diversify to a transport business. He also sees himself married and taking care of his family.  He describes himself as hardworking, honest and resilient.

loans.use: to purchase trousers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, green maize, tomatoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, aged 46, is married to Richard. They are blessed with four children: aged between four and 22 years. She operates a salon and beauty shop which has been in operation for eleven years. She earns a monthly income of KES40,000.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy hair and beauty products for her shop and salon. Petronila will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her daughter, who is in the university. She hopes to start selling second hand clothes in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her salon/beauty shop.

loans.name: Charles Ndolo

texts.en:
Charles is a single man and does not have any children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy ladies' blouses to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. 

Charles hopes to grow his business and in future open a big boutique in Nairobi Central Business District. He sees himself buying a plot of land and building his own house. He describes himself as humble, intelligent and focused.

loans.use: to buy ladies' blouses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rose has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. 

 Rose is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is 49 years old, married with four children aged 19-5 years old. He also looks after his mother. Abubakar owns a permanent house and lives there with five people at Hoima. 

For two years, Abubakar has been dealing in the transport business and from it has been able to educate his children. Abubakar faces a challenge of vehicle breakdowns but hopes to get three more vehicles just for transport. He is requesting a loan to top up and buy another vehicle.

loans.use: to buy another car.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Barbra has a business of a bridal care center, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase bridal dresses for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Barbra hopes to expand her business.  Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase bridal dresses for resale.

loans.name: Girumugisha Group

texts.fr:
Judith est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite  la localité de Mumuri au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 23ans. Elle était gardienne de vaches avant de commencer ce métier. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants de dont 3 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« GIRUMUGISHA».
texts.en:
Judith is a merchant, 30 years old, who lives in the town of Mumuri, in the middle of the country, in the Province of Gitega. She has been doing commerce in bananas for 23 years. She used to oversee cows before starting in this trade. She attended school through the sixth grade. She is married and the mother of seven children, of whom three are students in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 200,000 Burundi francs that Judith is obtaining will enable her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas for resale in order to make large profits. 

Judith is a member of the community group “GIRUMUGISHA”.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas for resale

loans.name: Kadijah

texts.en:
Kadijah is 48 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children.  Four of her children are currently in school.  Kadijah has a business of rental houses, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Kadijah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase materials to build more rental houses.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kadijah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Kadijah hopes to expand her business.  Kadijah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her build more rental houses

loans.use: to purchase materials to build more rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse est une femme qui pratique l’élevage semi – extensif. Elle achète des moutons et des vaches qu’elle intègre dans le troupeau familial. Ce troupeau est conduit chaque jour en brousse pour paitre. A son retour le soir, elle isole les  bêtes achetées pour leur donner un supplément alimentaire à base de résidus d’arachide. Elle les revend au bout de six mois .Elle vend également du lait caillé à domicile. L’emprunteuse est mariée et mère de trois filles et trois garçons .Aucun d’eux ne fréquent l’école ; les garçons gardent  les vaches à longueur de journée tandis que  les filles s’occupent des travaux ménagers. L’emprunteuse est à son quatrième prêt avec l’IMCEC. Elle sollicite un autre prêt de 500 000F pour acheter 03 bœufs, 04 moutons et 01 chèvre dont les produits de la vente l'aideront à s'occuper de ses enfants.Elle ambitionne de construire sa propre maison dans la ville.
texts.en:
This borrower is a woman who raises livestock semi-extensively. She purchases sheep and cows and adds them to the family herd. This herd is driven each day to the bush to feed. Then, in the evenings, she separates the purchased animals and gives them extra feed made from peanut refuse. At the send of six months, she sells them. She also sells curdled milk out of her house. 

This borrower is married and the mother of three girls and three boys. None of them attend school; the boys keep watch over the cows all day long, while the girls take care of the housework.  

This borrower is on her fourth loan with the micro-finance institution IMCEC. She is requesting another loan of 500,000 francs to buy 3 head of cattle, 4 sheep, and a goat. Selling them will help her to take care of her children. Her ambition is to build her own house in town.

loans.use: to buy 3 head of cattle, 4 sheep, and a goat

loans.name: Déthié

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un jeune marié il y’a seulement  six mois. Il tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques au bord de la route nationale qui traverse sa localité. Avec les bénéfices tirés de son commerce, il a ouvert un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires et a réalisé un verger dans lequel il fait du maraichage, de l’embouche bovine et y a planté des arbres fruitiers.Cette diversification de ses revenus est du au fait que malgré sa jeunesse, il supporte seul toutes les charges d’entretien de la famille qui est assez large. Sa générosité fait qu’il est très sollicité dans sa ville ou le chômage et le sous emploi sont très important. Il n’a jamais pris de prêt à l’IMCEC. Il demande aujourd’hui prêt de 400 000F pour compléter ses fonds et acheter un véhicule qui facilitera beaucoup ses activités.Son ambition est de se transformer en grossiste pour approvisionner les détaillants de sa localité.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who was married only six months ago. He has a shop selling cosmetics along the national road, which crosses his town. With the profits derived from his business, he opened a store selling grocery items. And he has a established an orchard where he cultivates a market garden, fattens cattle, and plants fruit trees. This diversification of his revenues is because, despite his young age, he is responsible for covering by himself all the expenses of his family, which is fairly large. 

His generosity means that much is asked of him in his city, where unemployment and under-employment are very high. 

He has never taken out a loan with IMCEC. Today, he is asking for a loan of 400,000 to round out his funds and to buy a vehicle for facilitating a lot of his work. His ambition is to become a wholesaler to supply the retailers in his town.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Ndone

texts.en:
Ndone is a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have one child aged five years old. He runs a restaurant at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years now and employs one person. He says that this business is profitable and the challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy food items to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big hotel. He also hopes to give his child a good education to university level. He describes himself as honest, humble and courageous.

loans.use: to buy more food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basins, mugs, plates, buckets to add to her business.

loans.name: Ndiaga Mahtar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires dans son village. Il s'approvisionne en ville à 15 km et a réussi à attirer une importante clientèle dans les villages environnants du fait de sa bonne crédibilité. Il assure avec les bénéfices générés par son activités l'essentiel des besoins de sa famille.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et satisfaire la forte demande, il sollicite un prêt e 400 000F pour acheter 15 sacs de riz et 100 litres d'huile. Il ambitionne de transformer sa boutique en magasin de vente en gros pour approvisionner les boutiques des villages de la zone.
texts.en:
The borrower manages a grocery store in his village. He gets his supplies from the city, 10 miles away, and has succeeded in attracting a large clientele from neighboring villages due to his good credibility.
With the profits generated by his business, he provides for most of his family's needs. To increase his working capital and satisfy the strong demand, he is requesting a 400,000 XOF loan, with which to purchase 15 bags of rice and 100 liters of cooking oil.
His ambition is to turn his shop into a wholesale store to supply the grocery stores in his area.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of rice and 100 liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old. She is a single mother of four children aged between twenty-two years old and three years old whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. She runs a restaurant in a residential area in Kitengela. She has been in this business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the challenge she has is financial constraints. 

Josephine is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy food items and renovate the business premises to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a big hotel where she will be making an income of Kes 90,000 per month. She describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: to buy food items and pay for renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes for his business.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 53 года. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Ее сын занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Мукарам зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mukaram lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 53 years old. She is divorced and has four children. Her son works as a day laborer in construction. Mukaram makes a living by breeding cattle. She breeds cattle for sale. She has been doing this for three years.  SHe is taking out a loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is 43 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has six children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Yudaya has a business making half bricks, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Yudaya has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase another machine that makes half bricks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yudaya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Yudaya hopes to expand her business.    Yudaya is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase another machine that makes half bricks.

Betty is 46 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has five children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Betty has a business of rental houses, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase materials like cement to complete some rental houses.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Betty hopes to expand her rental houses.  Betty is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cement to complete some rental houses.

loans.name: Fred

Fred is 43 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  He is married and has seven children.  Six of his children are currently in school.  Fred has a  furniture business that makes beds, which he has had for 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase lumber for making beds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Fred hopes to expand his business.   Fred is a member of Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standard of living.

Caroline is 35 years old. She is married and they have three children aged between fourteen years old and five years old whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. She runs a little restaurant in a residential area in Nairobi. She has been in this business for one year now. She says that this business is profitable and the challenge she has is financial constraints. 

Caroline is using her loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy food items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a big hotel. She says her dream is to become a millionaire in future. She describes herself as God-fearing, aggressive and committed.

loans.use: to buy food items

Sarah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Sarah has a small retail shop selling goods such as sugar, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business.    Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities.

loans.name: Rose

Rose is 28 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a beauty salon, which she has had for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  

In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.    Rose is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loans.use: to buy sheep, goats, and chickens to add to his business.

Jane is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school. Jane has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business into a wholesale business. Jane is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

texts.en:
Sylvia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school. Sylvia has a business growing mushrooms, which she has had for two years.
         
To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other items to improve the mushrooms.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business. Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by living a good life.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 1 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe set composé de 5 femmes vendeuses qui habitent dans un village.
elles  achétent en groupage de l'arachide pour en faire de la transformation en produits locaux (huile, aliments de bétails...).elles bénéficient d'une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans la transformation et dispose d'une bonne clientele. ce financement leur permettra d'augmenter leur fond de roulement, et d'entretenir et payer le scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of five businesswomen who live in the same village. They buy peanuts as a group to make them into local products (oil, livestock fodder, etc.). They have more than five years of experience in this business and have attracted a good clientele. This loan will permit them to grow their working capital, care for their children and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school. Joyce has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joyce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Joyce hopes to expand her business. Joyce is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Florence has a business selling food like "matooke" (green bananas), which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business.    Florence is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats, sheep, and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes vendeuses, leur activité principale est l'achat et la vente de mangue.
elles maitrisent l'activité et bénéficient d'une bonne clientele. Ces femmes ont une marge bénéficiaire de 50 pour cent de leur chiffre d'affaire. Avec ce fiancement elle verront leur niveau de vie augmenter et de pouvoir soutenir leur mari dans les depenses quotidienne de la maison
texts.en:
This group is composed of five businesswomen whose main activity is buying and selling mangoes. 

They are good at their business and have the advantage of having a good clientele. These women have a profit margin of 50 % of their turnover. With this loan they will improve their living conditions and be able to help their husbands with daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber, nails and a hack saw to increase his income

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Safina has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.  She has a second business roasting maize.  

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Safina hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. 

 In the future, Safina hopes to own a small retail shop that sells sugar. Safina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married to Kareauki. They are blessed with six children ages sixteen, fourteen, twelve, ten, eight and six years. He has been keeping livestock for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD. He  will use the loan to buy goats, cows, sheep and chicken to grow his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a piece of land for grazing the livestock. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children amd buy a piece of land for developing.

loans.use: To buy goats, cows, sheep and chicken to grow his business

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace‘s group is comprised of four hard-working young women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Grace has a small restaurant which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Grace hopes to build a house.    Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save and be hard-working.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and is married to Beatrice. They are blessed with four children; ages eighteen, fourteen, ten and five years. He has a hotel business which he has been doing for three years with a monthly income of KES 12,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of rice, flour, vegetables, cooking oil and charcoal. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children and use the rest as working capital. His hopes and dreams are to purchase land, build rental houses, and purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, flour, vegetables, cooking oil and charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, and baking-powder

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 42 years old and married to John. They are blessed with four children ages twenty, eighteen, fifteen and ten years old. She has been running a retail shop for six years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by the KADET staff. She will use the loan to add to her stock of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and buy goats to raise. Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop and a hardware shop.

loans.use: To add sugar, rice, and wheat flour to her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats, sheep and donkeys to sell

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is 31 years old and married to Mawia. They are blessed with three children, ages 10, 7, and 3. He has been a shopkeeper for the past eleven years. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add inventory of cooking fat and wheat flour maize meal in his shop.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children and provide for his family's needs. His hopes and dreams are to purchase some land, build a house, and purchase his own vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat and wheat flour maize meal for his shop

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 32 years old and married to Musyoka. They are blessed with three children ages 10, 8 and 4 years old. She has been running a retail shop for nine years with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to add sugar, maize meal and rice to her retail shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children, expand her business and start livestock farming. Her hopes and dreams are to purchase land and build rental houses, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize meal and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking fat for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more welding metals, plain sheets and welding accessories.

loans.name: Tutugirl

texts.en: Tutugirl is 33 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education in the 4th grade. She is married and has three children between 7 and 15 years old who are in school and live at home. Hr husband has been a contractor (building ) for the past 10 years. She has been selling oil, rice, pepper  and charcoal. She started this business with charcoal and learned it from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, pepper, and charcoal, for her business. She likes her business because it enables her to take care of her family. Her plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, pepper, and charcoal

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 49 years old and married to Phyllis. He has been running a motorcycle taxi as his primary business and hawking milk as his secondary business for two years with a monthly income of KES.10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to service his motorbike to help him supply milk to different places. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes are for them continuing their education up to the university level.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 3 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 5 femme vendeuse, elles ont une expérience de plus de 7 ans dans le commerce. leur activité principale est l'achat d'arachide pour  la transformation de produits locaux (huile, aliment bétail etc ). leur lieu de vente est le marché du village. Ce groupe dispose d une bonne clientele, ce qui leur permettra avec ce financement de voir une augmentation de revenu. 
DE puvoir pendre en charge la scolarité de leurs enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of five businesswomen who have more than seven years of experience in commerce. Their main activity is buying peanuts to transform into local products (oil, livestock fodder, etc.) They make their sales in the village marketplace. This group has a sizeable clientele which, given this loan, will permit them to increase their incomes and be responsible for paying school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats, sheep and cattle

loans.name: Grace Nyabeta

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old, married, and has three children aged between sixteen years old and seven years old. She operates a small retail business selling sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages, kerosene and other items.

Grace has been running this business for two years now. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene and other items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and religious.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and kerosene.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour and a television set for his hotel

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 24 years old and married to Patricia. They are blessed with one child aged one year. Paul has been running a restaurant for the past year with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.
 
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add a stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and purchase a television set for his restaurant. 

With the anticipated profit from his business he will construct his own house and relocate his family. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and construct a big restaurant in his home town.

loans.use: To add a stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, and purchase a television set.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase slippers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 61 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte de triciclo y también tiene su agencia de servicios de viajes. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, el negocio de la agencia lo heredo de su esposo quien falleció y fue con la ayuda de este negocio que invirtió en la compra de triciclos y brindar este servicio que le generara ganancias ella tiene a una persona que trabaja diariamente y le entrega una parte del dinero y la otra parte que le corresponde a Imelda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de un triciclo que se encuentra en buen estado.
texts.en: Imelda, 61, provides transportation services in a three-wheeled vehicle; she also has a travel agency.  She’s had the business for over 5 years.  She inherited the travel agency from her husband when he died and support from this business helped her purchase the three-wheeled vehicles to provide this new service that generates profits for her.  She has an employee that works for her daily and part of what is earned goes to Imelda.  She is asking for the loan to buy a three-wheeled vehicle that’s in good condition.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled vehicle.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
This borrower is a 41-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between 2 and 9 years old. The older two are in school, and her husband is a driver.

For the past seven years she has owned a general store selling various goods such as mineral water, sugar, and beans.  This business has enabled her to feed her family and develop herself and her family’s standard of living.

She will use this loan to reinvest in her general store and buy various items such as rice and sugar.

With additional profits she will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Reyna Aquilina

texts.es: Reyna Aquilina tiene 40 años con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Y surgió con la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, El negocio lo aprendí desde la edad de 12 años con su mama ya que en vida se dedicaba a la misma actividad. Ya de forma independiente tengo aproximadamente 16 años de ejercerlo, como madre soltera tenía que buscar los recursos para mantener a mis hijos y mi hogar. Ella espera muy pronto proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda, para que sus hijos puedan vivir con las condiciones necesarias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, perfumes, cremas, calzado, bolsos, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en:
Reyna Aquilina is 40 years old and with much effort she has been able to advance her family. All of a sudden, she faced the necessity of paying for the family's expenses. She had learned about business at the age of 12 from her mother, who while alive carried out the same activity.

Independently, Reyna has 16 years doing this. As a single mother she had to find resources to maintain her children and her home. She hoped to quickly provide improvements in the home, so her children could live under proper conditions. 

The loan she solicits is for working capital to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, shoes, purses, and treatments, among other things, to sell.

loans.use: buy clothing, perfumes, creams, shoes, purses, and treatments, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plantain and peppers to sell

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 32 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado. Ella dio inicio por su esposo, con las ganancias el obtenía empezaron a compra pocos productos y fueron obteniendo cada días más, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo por los que tiene que velar todos los días. Maria tiene toda la fortaleza para salir adelante por lo que cada día fue ganando clientes  y con la confianza que les brinda todo se hace mucho más fácil para ofertarles lo que desean. Solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ropa, joyas, cosméticos, cremas, colonias y calzado.
texts.en: María Mercedes, 32, is a young woman selling general merchandise.  She’s been in business over 7 years and has always enjoyed it.  She started thanks to her husband.  With profits he earned they started buying a few products and continued to obtain more each day.  She has three children in her care so she has to watch them every day.  María has all the strength needed to get ahead so she’s been winning over customers daily and because of the trust she inspires in them selling what they want to them becomes so much easier.  She’s asking for this loan to buy clothes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, colognes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase slippers for her business.

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es:
José es un padre soltero de 26 años que vive en el cantón de Santo Domingo, su pequeño hijo tiene tres años de edad y actualmente asiste a un centro educativo.

Años atrás pasó por una mala racha, estuvo desempleado por un tiempo pero hoy en día José se dedica a vender a los bazares productos naturales desde hace 8 años, esto lo aprendió gracias a la recomendación de una amiga. No cuenta con movilización propia por lo que llevar grandes cajas es una tarea difícil. Muy temprano en la mañana en comienza su jornada, ya que debe empezar con el oficio de ser padre. Procura terminar todas sus actividades lo antes posible para así dedicarle tiempo a su hijo quien es su razón de ser. José quiere invertir en mercadería por lo que acudió a Fundación Alternativa en busca de un crédito. 

Su gran meta es dar a su hijo una educación completa, verlo crecer feliz y poder darle una vida digna. Con este crédito el quiere mejorar su calidad de vida, él sueña con tener un auto para facilitar su trabajo y poder tener más ingersos.
texts.en:
José is a 26 year old single father who lives in the Santo Domingo settlement.  His young son is three years old and attends a preschool.

Years ago, because of bad luck, he was unemployed for some time, but now José sells organic products at local bazaars and has been doing so for eight years.  He learned this, thanks to the recommendation from a friend.  He doesn’t have his own transportation, so moving large boxes is difficult.  He begins his work early in the morning, because his fatherly duties come first.  He tries to finish everything as soon as possible so that he can devote more time to his son, who is his reason for being.  José wants to invest in merchandise, so he approached Fundación Alternativa for a loan.

His greatest goal is to provide a complete education for his son, watch him grow happy, and be able to give him a dignified life.  This loan will help him to improve his quality of life.  His dream is to have a car to make transportation easier and help him generate more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ssuubi Development Association Group

texts.en:
From the very beginning, 50-year-old Mary stressed to her workers the need for diligence if her poultry business was to have good prospects. She wanted her business to be reckoned among the best in the metropolis of Kampala. Once she zeroed in on what gives this genre of business a vantage point, she went to every length to see to it that she purchases more bags of chicken mash, medicine and layer chickens.

That was her way of making a statement that she was in for the long haul and that she wanted to make quick headway. Though her journey from the start was fraught with many challenges like the lack of financing for the purchase of more chickens, she nevertheless obtained a footing.

The way she has organised and planned for her business the last 10 years bears all the hallmarks of success.

Mary is to all appearances a buoyant and assiduous lady. She is happily married with eight high-spirited kids. She says the inspiration before she took root in this business came from her close friends.

On the side, she ekes out additional income from two other businesses--bricks sales and rentals.

This Kiva loan, Mary says, will be used to purchase more layer chickens and chicken mash and she says she will use the rest to pay fees for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more layer hens, chicken mash, and use the rest of the loan to pay fees for her kids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and oil for the business.

loans.name: Olga Marie  Adelaïde

texts.fr:
Femme marié de 44ans et  mère de quatre enfants dont l'âge varient de 17 à 25ans dont trois sont scolarisés.A la fin de  sa classe de troisième elle se lance dans la vente des objets plastiques avec un capital de 125.000 frs en 1996.ses ventes journalières varient de 15000 à 40000frs.

Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son activité en achetant des ustensiles en plastiques tel que des cuvettes, des paniers, des gobelets, des seaux et des paniers a linge.Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands marches de la capitale et parfois  a Kinshasa

Elle a pour stratégie de vendre à des prix favorables,  afin de favoriser les achats de ses clients a proximite de leurs habitations .
Pour l'avenir , elle pense beaucoup epargner et faire des gros benefices pour assurer l'avenir de ses enfants et leur scolarite.
texts.en:
This lady is 44 years old with four children between 17 and 25 years old, three of whom attend school. In 1996, after third grade, she began selling plastic goods, using startup capital of 12,000 FRS. Today, her daily takings range from 15,000 to 40,000 FRS. 

She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing plastic kitchen utensils such as bowls, baskets, cups, buckets and laundry baskets. She sources her goods from the capital's main markets and sometimes from Kinshasa. Her strategy is to sell at reasonable prices to draw in customers from their nearby homes. In the future she would like to generate significant profits and put some savings aside in order to provide for her children's future and education.

loans.use: to purchase plastic kitchen utensils, bowls, baskets, cups and buckets

loans.name: Fight Against Shame Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “For against Shame” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member to improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. A widow, Isatu has six children. One of her children is in primary school, two are in secondary school, one is in college and the others are no longer attending school. 

Isatu sells clothes for both men and women. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu is going to buy both men and women’s clothes in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy men and women’s clothes in bulk
